Reviews.Title: “Would be great for a longish stay”
Reviews.Author: council_worker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights whilst attending a training course / seminar. Room was huge, bed comfortable, two tv's, kitchen, washing machine & dryer - what more could you need for a stay in Sydney? If there was a draw-back, the north facing rooms have a magnificent view of a brick wall. This, however, was a minor distraction from an otherwise great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to discover Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Twinkle1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in a 2 bedroom apartment and it was perfect for our family. The apartment was not huge but adequate for 2 adults and 2 children age 12 and 14. What made the Hotel very special was it's location as it is within walking distance to most places!! We thought we would be taking taxi's everywhere but the only taxi's we needed were to and from the airport as we walked everywhere else! A great base for a fabulous time in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money and nice comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Sarahtravellover
Reviews.Content: Lobby and cafe are presented and give a sophisticated feel. Expensive parking ($50) with very little spaces, elevators wrre also very slow! Rooms were a good size with a comfortable bed and attractive split level studio apartment. Lovely bathroom with modern facilities, 2 televisions, kitchenette and small balcony. Good location and would defiantly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “some reception staff need training in smiling at customers”
Reviews.Author: Willowrowan
Reviews.Content: We rrived for a week with a couple of friends after a blissfulstay in Bali. The reception staff allocated us room 1413, a two bed apartment. The bedrooms were cramped as was the single bathroom. Although this may have been ok for a family, we have reached he stage where we like or own en suite, due to frequent nocturnal visits. The other couple felt the same, so, before unpacking, we returned to reception to enquire if perhaps we could each have rooms with ensuite. Big mistake. The male receptionist told us that nothing was available and even if it had been, we would still have to pay for the room we had been given. His manner was bordering on offensive, and when I commented that I found his attitude aggressive and not to be expected in a 5 star hotel, he replied,'It's not, this is a four and a half star hotel'. On returning to our room I dug out the print out I had downloaded about the hotel which did indeed give it five stars. I returned to the receptio area to show it to the receptionist, who said, 'where did you get that? It is wrong! where did it come from?' I replied that I had downloaded it from google. He replied, 'well, it's wrong'. It wasn't until I had gone back to our room and read the small print about the hotel i saw it had been submitted by the owner, but left it at that and all decided that due to the above treatment, we would spend nothing in the hotel. That said, it was wonderfully central, surroundd by top class restaurants and cafes, and the excellent housemaid for our floor kept us supplied with fresh line. the washing machine and dryer in the bathroom was also a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Nairina
Reviews.Content: Had four enjoyable nights at the Mantra on Bond and could not be happier with the location - smack bang in the middle of all that is good in Sydney! Room was quiet and a decent size with good amenities including a spotless and modern kitchen. Bathroom was bizarre though - feel very sorry for the cleaners whose job must be made difficult by the swinging shower door that allows the water to spray right across the room - rendering the floor slippery and dangerous. Bed was comfy enough but both my partner and I awoke with sore backs each morning. Kudos to the manager though, after checking out I needed somewhere private to feed my baby and we were given a clean room for the hour, for that reason alone I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in best part of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jsorensen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mantra 2 for 3 days in April 2012. Location is about as perfect as it can get, 10 mins from Circular Quay, 10 mins from Pitt st. shopping, less than 5 from train station to the airport, still walking distance to Darling Harbour, and lots of good food within a very short walk. Room was very nice with a separate sleeping area and living area, plus it had free washing machine/dryer in the room which is wonderful when you're on a 3 week trip. In addition room was spotlessly clean, no complaints there. The only negatives were that the hotel is starting to get a little dated, and they were trying to charge you extortionate rates for Internet access, which is ridiculous for 2012. Go down to one of the non national monopoly telco shops and get a data sim instead for AUD $30 and stick it into your unlocked android phone or tablet and use that for Internet and wifi. I'd definitely be looking at the Mantra again next time I make it down to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Free WiFi Across the Square”
Reviews.Author: gbf1
Reviews.Content: We had an executive Studio apartment for 6 nights and it was perfect for two, plenty of room, nice living area and balcony with views of Australia Square, all the kitchen facilities youâ€™d want and a nice bedroom area, set at the back of the room, so we didnâ€™t suffer from street noise, also being on a high floor helps. We found Sydney cheaper than Melbourne but Oz is still expensive, so we tended to eat in more and thereâ€™s a large supermarket and booze shop, very important, a few blocks up George Street. The hotel entrance is a bit sanitary and reception wasnâ€™t over friendly, by Australian standards but we got what we wanted there and the rooftop pool was outstanding, although other skyscrapers did shadow it, in the late afternoon. However, Iâ€™d contracted a septic toe, so I couldnâ€™t use it or have a dip at Bondi Beach, much to my disappointment but our involvement with the Australian Medicare system was pleasant, plenty of Health Centres about and we got a refund on some of the cash weâ€™d spent, well worth knowing about the refund. The hotel situation was superb, most places were within a few minutes walk and there was a Wally Tourist bus stop nearby, in the morning the tourist bus would be full by the time it got past there, so it was a good situation. We met a friend in Katoomba, in the Blue Mountains and instead of getting an expensive tourist bus we bought a ticket at Wynyard Street Station, just across the road which covered, the metro, the train and the Katoomba Tourist Bus, terrific value. Also, you can buy day passes for the ferries and public transport at Circular Quay, where the huge liners pull in and we loved the Rocks area, although never did find the craft brewery we spent ages looking for and we did feel very safe wondering about the main areas in the city. Our only major complaint about the hotel, apart from the fact I kept on tripping over the small step into the bathroom, was the usual one of big chains charging for WiFi, we saw a poor woman sweating over how to get onto her iPad, in reception and paying through the nose for it. As usual, there are plenty of places who are glad of your custom and let you have free access. Our favourite was the Grand, about 50 yards diagonally across Australia Square, a busy bustling square favoured by the office workers, early doors. We didnâ€™t try the restaurant at the Grand but the bar was like an old UK one with wood panelling, friendly staff, reasonably priced beer by Oz standards and easily accessed WiFi, the only thing that surprised us was, it shut on a Sunday, bit like Scotland when I was a lad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel albeit cramped.”
Reviews.Author: Alistair D
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The rooms are a little on the cramped side, but to be expected in the inner-city area. Great location to circular quay and only 30 second walk from major train station and supermarket, a short walk from the main mall. The kitchen is sufficient for making breakfast etc. Two issues were that the sofa bed was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in in my entire life. Secondly, the drainage in the bathroom had some issues which caused half of the bathroom to flood when the shower was used. However the room was clean and the hotel appeared to be well maintained. Would stay again however would get two rooms instead of a two-bedroom room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very tired and dirty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexanders44
Reviews.Content: Arrived march 2012, a trip around Australia for a month. Hotel very disappointing. Had 3 different rooms. The room we eventually stayed in for remaining 4 nights vetted by receptionist who advised that it was the best of a bad lot. That one if the rooms they were going to give us she wouldn't have put her dog in because it was so unclean. We originally booked a studio apartment which was dirty on our arrival advised if we spent another 40 dollars per night we could upgrade usually 80 dollars.. Took this offer but took another 2 rooms before it was reasonably ok. Hotel in need of major refurbishment. Unfortunately would not recommend friends to stay ehich is a grat pity as the location is fantastic. Pull your socks up mantra. Get the hotel fixed and clean up your act such a shame!!!!,

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: Nordvard
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable, bathroom lovely and the location is fantastic. We stayed in a group of two couples. We booked a two bedroom suite and were told this would include a living room and two bathrooms. It turns out we were given 1501A, which is two bedrooms and a common bathroom locked off from the rest of a three bedroom suite. So there was no lounge or common area in our unit, just the two bedrooms and a hall leading to the bathroom. This was fine but disappointing and not as advertised. When we arrived to the room the beds were half made, the mini bar was obviously halfway through being restocked and it was clear maid service wasn't complete. Also there was a large sopping wet section of carpet in one of the bedrooms, and the huge balcony, which stretched on to incorporate a couple of other suites (so be sure to lock your balcony doors), was covered in sand. We asked for someone to sweep the balcony and see to the wet carpet, neither of which happened. Despite those negatives the hotel was worthwhile and served our purposes. We got a good room rate directly through the hotel and breakfast downstairs was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: CJANDLJ1
Reviews.Content: Very good, tidy, city hotel. Had a 2 bedroom apartment with a huge balcony. Was on a girls weekend and it was just perfect. 2 doors from the Establishment and a block from the Ivy. But this would also be perfect for families as its central to Circular Quay, Wynyard station and the city. Only downside was the 2 bedroom only had 1 bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Caroliz B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom apartment for four nights. It was a lovely, spacious, comfortable apartment with a modern, well equipped kitchen area. It was very clean and serviced every day. The cooker, dishwasher and washing machine were efficient. It was a short walk in one direction to the harbour and in the other to the shopping area and a large supermarket. From the swimming pool area you could see the top of the Bridge. There is a parking bay outside the hotel which you can use to unload your car, if it is full ask the receptionist for help and you should be allowed to park for free, for a short time, in the hotel carpark.

Reviews.Title: “Great sized rooms and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Superprofits
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for business. Very central with large rooms. Beats a small hotel room. Also had good breakfast in the lobby. Next to the establishment club/bar so don't have to go far for good food and wine. Highly recommend for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Weirdest room layout - Best Breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: SilverGoddess47
Reviews.Content: My son & I sayed here for one in seperate rooms on the 7th floor. Sons room was fine apart from the very small bathroom (couldn't sit straight on the toilet set! My room was a totally different layout, worst i've ever come across, too much furniture in the sitting area and the bathroom was too small. door bangs on the toilet, lucky i was the only one in the room. the kitchen completely cuts the room off. Bed was good, (only one reading lamp),good facilities I suppose with a washer dryer in a cupbaord in the too small bathroom could be handy but difficult. All in all a quite nice stay but probably wouldn't choose this one unless the price was amazing. I will however happily go back for breakfast! That was best eggs bennedict ever. Staff were very friendly in the bar/breakfast room. The room was quite clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Wanderingnewyorker
Reviews.Content: My family of three (including a teenager) had a 2 bedroom apartment for 4 nights at the Mantra. The location is terrific--walking distance from everything. The train to the airport is easily accessible as well. We paid a slightly higher rate to include breakfast, which was a good idea as the prices on the menu were high. We could have cooked our own breakfast in the apartment if we had wanted to, but we were on vacation.... The room could do with some freshening (frayed carpet, scratches on the wall, etc.) The bathroom was also tiny, although well-designed. The beds were comfortable and the living room area of the apartment was spacious. There is also a washer and dryer in the apartment, which saves a bundle if you are traveling with kids. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: Teegsy07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a work event in Sydney. This place was great, nice bed, clean bathroom. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better....but overall fine”
Reviews.Author: c73
Reviews.Content: Whilst our stay here was not bad, I had expected better. In my previous life I had booked this apartment often for clients - though admittedly a few years ago now and under a previous name Saville. Perhaps I was a little too hopeful thinking I could easily fit 4 adults and 2 young children in a 2 bedroom apartment, but I had expected it to be bigger. ie the portacot only just fitted into our room (but meant not being able to walk around the bed or use the desk) We were told the lounge had a sofa bed for my 2 year old but it didn't so they gave us a rollaway - which did not fit in the other room so kept it in the lounge taking up what little spare space we had even when folded up (and as a side issue was awful to lie on - ok for kids but would never put an adult on it) Bathroom was tiny tiny as well. Basically I think it needs a good makeover, it is very tired, a lick of paint, a very good clean could make a world of difference. Also small things like extra glasses in the room (we seemed to be constantly ringing to get things for the kitchen) On the plus side though the staff were very very pleasent and efficient, they could not be faulted at all (other than perhaps the cleaning staff could be trained up on how to get a room clean, small things like dusting, cleaning out hairs form previous guests, vacuuming the rooms and hallways of bugs ...) The location is also top notch - so close to everything like shopping, rocks/circular quay. There is a supermarket right across the road which was so handy to have, oh and Fratellis Fresh new CBD store just around the corner - exceptional! So whilst I would not stay here again for 5 nights with so many people (even just 4 adults would be cramped in my opinion) If they spruced the place up a bit, thought more carefully about the small things that matter, and improved their cleaning I would consider staying again with a smaller party due to location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pilotss2001
Reviews.Content: This is a pricey place but you are located in the center of everything. Everything is a short walk from the hotel. The Rocks, The Opera House, the rail line, Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, and Sydney Harbour, shopping and night life. The well known bar the Establishment is 5 Meters from the hotel. The hotel is not much from outside but the rooms, the roof deck pool, and jacuzzi are great! Large space with modern appliances in the studios. The beds are comfortable and the service is helpful. The hotel has cafe in the lobby and room service is available. This hotel is pricey and the location deserves this price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, and very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: jujujulia
Reviews.Content: Really comfortable hotel. Love how spacious this is, would be great for an extended stay due to the separate lounge / dining area and the sizable kitchen. Minor disappointments: no herbal tea in the kitchen, had to pay $6 for a peppermint tea with breakfast, which seemed a bit excessive when I have a kettle in my room! Breakfast room service didn't start til 6:30, which was a bit late for me as I needed to get to the office early. Would have preferred a 5:30 / 6pm breakfast instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for self-catering in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Shona-Charlie
Reviews.Content: We booked a 10 night stay at the hotel as part of our round the world trip. It was important to us to find an apart-hotel as we wanted to have the option of eating in on some nights and also the option to launder our clothes. As regular Tripadvisor users we watched this hotel rating drop from the mid-20's to the mid-40's over 10 months so we were a little concerned about it. Most of the poorer reviews were about outside noise and the quality of the rooms. However, we have no complaints. The hotel did exactly what it said on the tin - offered a decent apart-hotel right in the city centre. There's not much I would add that others have said before us other than BE SURE YOU REALLY WANT TO STAY BANG IN THE MIDDLE OF THE CBD. This was a repeat visit to Sydney for me after nearly 20 years. Sydney is so much busier than I remembered and being bang in the middle of the CBD of course there would be more noise but I don't think we expected the crush of people during the day. And that's our fault really for not giving that some thought beforehand. Often when we left the hotel in the morning we were met by waves of people coming out of the train station and rushing along to work. And then the same in reverse at 5pm. On Friday and Saturday nights it is much noisier with music from clubs and therefore people out and about on the streets. But, on the other hand, I appreciate that might, for some people, be a good reason to book the Mantra. Certainly, to put it in some context, if we ever return to Australia we would consider booking other Mantra apartments but in Sydney we would look for something a bit quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AnneDM
Reviews.Content: Close to all the attractions. Staff weren't very helpful and no free wifi,so probably wouldn't stay here again. Howewer, the apartments were comfortable. Small rooftop pool. Only room for 2 so you have to hope no one else wants to use it. Expensive but most things in Sydney are!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SK F
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable 2 night stay at Mantra 2 Bond Street. The service at the front desk was excellent, and the location of the property is superb. The room was spacious and clean. The only grip would be that the air conditioner appeared to be quite an old system and was quite noisey and rattled a lot during the night. Everything else was good.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Jono J
Reviews.Content: Good location across the road from railway station and a short walk to Circular Quay. Rooms are spacious and self contained. Sometimes utensils (plates/cutlery etc) are missing and staff are always responsive in replacing missing items. Try to get rooms on higher floors as George St can get quite noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Maintaining a High standard”
Reviews.Author: Westoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and chose this hotel as we had enjoyed our stay there in 2005. Our apartment was comfortable, clean and with a good range of amenities to meet our requirements during our three days in Sydney. Its central location is ideal and it provided a good meeting place for our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jaytee40
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to the Rocks and Harbour Bridge and shops. Well laid out room with laundry facilities in bathroom. Quiet which was good as it was in the city. The only negative was that the view from the room was not very nice as overlooked old buildings but then you are in a city! Dishwasher was out of order but it was not a major issue as we didn't really cook in the apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Standards have not slipped”
Reviews.Author: BrianL898
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 8 years ago when it was the Saville. We had requested a 2 bedroom apartment only to be upgraded to a 3 bedroom penthouse, pity we only had the one night. Staff were brilliant, courteous and very helpful. Could not be better placed for the CBD/Circular Quay/Rocks area. We will quite happily return.

Reviews.Title: “perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: k8oops_10
Reviews.Content: Initial impression was not good as we had room 1313 on the 13th floor! However our every whim was catered for and the staff were pleaxsant and polite, the little kitchen lacks utensils if you truly want to self cater and the cupboard door and the fridge door go in opposite directions so is almost impossible to access! The swimming pool and hot tub on the roof of the 18th floor caters for 4 people only so was a little bizzare for such a large place and is seriously tired with many broken or missing tiles! Despite that and the relentless sirens and builders outside our door we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone, the noise first thing in the morning as the city awakes starts very early and very loudly but to be fair we are not city people and found the whole Sydney experience a bit of a culture shock, the beds were made daily and a quick clean round but no floors were cleaned during our 8 night stay. I am glad to be back home in the country but nevertheless will remember our time at the Mantra fondly.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for Circular Quays and surrounding area”
Reviews.Author: Lins1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my elderly parents in January 2012, the apartment was spacious, clean and had all the facilities we needed. An ideal base for exploring Circular Quays and the surrounding area and within easy reach of the free bus, which helped with parents mobility difficulties. The pool was ideal for an early morning swim and the 1st floor terrace area calm and relaxing for a quick smoke. Would definitely stay here again the staff are friendly and helpful and everything is within easy reach!

Reviews.Title: “Bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: angel1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February with my Mother and Sister. Location is great and we walked down to Darling Harbour every morning for breakfast. Was on the 5th floor and was very noisy on a Saturday night with lots of partying going on in the street. We had a two bedroom apartment but it disappointingly only had 1 bathroom. I must have been mistaken when I thought I booked an apartment with two bathrooms. The bedrooms were very small, but we weren't there most of the time so it didn't make too much difference. The apartment was well equipped with kitchen facilities (not that we used them) and a laundry should you wish to do washing whilst away. The housekeeping was very good and the place felt clean. The apartments are getting a bit tired and shabby though. The windows could do with a really good wash! Could hardly see out the window for all the built up grime on the outside of the building. Thought it was very overpriced for how tired the room was looking. Will next time book 2 separate rooms at a hotel considering it will be around the same price. Reception staff were friendly enough and held onto our bags both when we arrived (our room was ready) and when we checked out (late flight). Probably wouldn't stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location and large room”
Reviews.Author: SarahF818
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mantra 2 Bond Street in September 2011 with my Mum. The check-in was smooth and our luggage was held until we were able to check-in to our room. The room was fantastic, it was very big with kitchen facilities including a refrigerator. There was also lounge chairs and two televisions in the room. The bathroom was a decent size. The pool on the roof-top is a decent size if there are not too many people there. We went swimming on a Sunday morning so we were the only ones there!The hotel organised our transportation for our early morning flight. The best aspect is the location to Circular Quay and all the other tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Eli387
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mantra for a week in January while my daughter was working in Sydney and was suitably impressed. The studio appartment on the 10th floor was spacious,clean and well equipped with a very comfy bed and the added bonus of a balcony overlooking George Street-so when the small rooftop pool area was full(only 4 loungers) I could catch the late afternoon sun there.One reason I chose the Mantra was for the rooftop pool..a welcome retreat and oasis from the city.It was in an excellent location being close to both the CBD(for the great shops and sales!)and only 10mins walk to Circular Quay and the Rocks.The cafe sold adequate coffees and breakfasts but I found it cheaper and more choice to walk across the road to the food courts in the shopping mall.Internet use was very expensive-far better to find a cheap internet cafe close by. Reception staff were fine. Only slight criticism was the late cleaning of the room..often mid-afternoon but overall I was very happy with the Mantra and would recommend to friends and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but that's about all its offering.”
Reviews.Author: Simon C
Reviews.Content: I travel interstate often for business and have stayed at many hotels in Sydney. Mantra 2 Bond Street has a fantastic location, close to train stations, Circular Quay and Sydney Harbour. Although my work pays for my accommodation I find this hotel to be very expensive and somewhat overpriced. The rooms are pleasant, the kitchen is well equipped and having a laundry in the room is a bonus. The rooms at the front of the hotel can be quite noisy, so if you are a light sleeper remember to ask for a quiet room. The staff are not overly friendly or helpful, and internet and parking are both expensive. Overall my experience wasn't bad but I'd much rather stay in hotel where you receive the "whole" package

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: AWarr
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in The Mantra and Apartment really well appointed and spacious. This apartment hotel is right on the main shopping street and is so convenient for all attractions. There is a good supermarket called 'Woolworths' opposite the apartment in the shopping mall, lower ground floor. They sell a huge selection of fresh, frozen goods and groceries. We bought cereals, milk etc. for our breakfast which was great and better than using a cafe every day. We walked to where all the ferries, trains and buses depart from at Circular Quay in just 5 mins. We were advised to buy a 'MyMulti' card for 20 australian dollars which allows a days travel on all the ferries, buses and trains. This is Great value as we went to so many places in and around Sydney and just showed the travel card and there is no limit how many times you use it in a 24 hour period. If you were in Sydney longer you can buy a Mymulti card for longer periods which are even better value. The ferries take you to all the surrounding islands and it is a great way to see the whole area from the water. This hotel was a good choice, and although it was a busy road we had no problem with noise. Laundry facilities in apartment were great and had washing powder for your use. Bliss when you are travelling around Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear, not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: roamingroto
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with our stay at the Mantra 2 Bond Street. The check in was good, with a helpful Receptionist providing a map and information on nearest food stores. After that, it went downhill. We had a 1 bed studio apartment on the 5th floor. Lift only operates if you swipe your room card, but it doesn't always work first time. On exiting the lift we noticed the corridor carpets were badly stained and had bits of litter strewn about. As we approached our suite the carpets became even more worn & stained outside the Housekeeping Room where bleach had been dropped. Our suite had a view of a brick wall. The curtains were filthy dirty, as was the double glazed window, which did open onto a tiny Juliette balcony which looked down onto an alleyway between the Mantra and the bar next door. This alleyway was used by the skateboarders and was very noisy. The room was very dark, the kitchen area looked OK, but was very poorly equipped with only one tiny saucepan and an electric frying pan that looked as if dog food had been cooked in it and never cleaned - YUK!! The purpose of choosing the Mantra suite was to do a bit of self-catering on our month long trip but this was absolutely impossible given the poor facilities. The laundry facility in the bathroom was about the only thing that lived up to expectations, but the iron had been used too hot by a previous occupant and scorched our clothing. Housekeeping didn't show up till 3.45pm one day, we had just got back in after being out since 9.30 am. We asked if he could pop back in half an hour since we were using the bathroom. He told us he was finishing now, so gave us clean towels but we had to make our own bed. Couldn't really recommend this place to anyone even though the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Decent home from home”
Reviews.Author: Bebej1976
Reviews.Content: Had a studio room for one night. Â Knowing that accommodation standards in Sydney can be very variable and the star rating system almost useless I wasn't sure what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised. The studio was large with the added bonus that the sleeping area was blocked off from the main area by means of a partial wall and was out of view if u had guests etc. Â It had a dining table, full kitchen and washing machine and dryer. The furniture while not new was comfortable and well maintained. We could even see a slither of the harbor through the window. Â There was even two flatscreen tv's in the studio. Â One in the living area and one in the sleeping area. Â The only thing lacking from the apartment which would have been great was a balcony.Â  There was a great rooftop area with a pool, and BBQ complete with 360 degree views of Sydney. The only time we had any contact with the staff was at check in and check out. Â Both interactions were pleasant and swift. The property has a great location. It is opposite Wynyard train Station and is a less than ten minute walk south to the harbor or north to Town Hall shopping area. I was a bit apprehensive about noise as I've read other reviews on here complaining about it. Â We were staying a Saturday night and there was a little bit of noise in the corridors but nothing significant.Â  Internet and parking seemed hugely expensive but we didn't use either of these.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Hairypony
Reviews.Content: We were put up here by my husband's company and spent about 7 weeks in a studio apartment. This has a small kitchen with dishwasher and a washing machine with tumble drier in the bathroom. The kitchen was not fully equipped so we had to buy some stuff to keep us going. Housekeeping was done on a daily basis, which tended to involve making the bed, loading the dishwasher and putting in new towels and basic cleaning. I think they clean the room from top to bottom between guests. Our room overlooked George street on the 13th floor, with a tiny balcony, which you could probably drag a dining chair out to sit on, but it is very noisy. The rooms are not double glazed, so even though we were on the 13th floor, the road noise still managed to get through. We found Friday and Saturday nights particularly noisy, especially from the Establishment a 'trendy' bar a short walk away, as people spilled out of the front smoking and generally being noisy. Also they would hangout in the small alleyway between the Mantra building and the Establishment. Add this to the constant drone of traffic on George Street and the 'boy racers' with their oversized exhaust pipes cruising up and down George Street into the early hours, made for a noisy sleeping environment. I would recommend ear plugs if you are easily disturbed by noise as I am. I would have to say however, that not once was I disturbed by our neighbours, which would suggest soundproofing between rooms was very good. Shame they didn't put double glazing in! Our door was near the lifts so sometimes you would get people who would congregate and chat by the lifts after a night out, but overall they wouldn't be too much of a problem. There is a swimming pool on the 18th floor, although after a quick visit, it wasn't very big and had been taken over by a crowd who were using it and the BBQ located there as well, so didn't bother again. It probably isn't big enough to do much swimming, but if you fancy a little splash about and cool down it will be fine. The TV was limited, I know if you are on holiday, you aren't going to stay in and watch TV! Location wise, this property is very good being only a five minute walk to Circular Quay and the Rocks and a short walk to the main shopping areas. So for sightseeing it is well located. There are also a number of supermarkets located very close by. The closest being Woolworths in the Metcentre, but this was only open when the Metcentre was open. There is Coles at Wynyard which was open till quite late and a Coles Central with a Liquorland located on George Street & King Street so you can get groceries and milk easily. There is no free wi-fi. My view of this property is a little different from others as we had to live there, before we moved into our permanent home, rather than stay as a tourist. If you want somewhere that is very well located for your holidays then I would say go for this property. If you are intending to live there for a while and want something a little quieter, then I would suggest there maybe better serviced apartments to suit these needs.

Reviews.Title: “Mantra 2”
Reviews.Author: Wilson54420
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central and in an absolutely convenient location in Sydney. We had a two bedroom unit and it had a kitchen and washer/dryer (in the bathroom). We stayed over New Years Eve for two nights and Sydney is beyond busy for New Years because of the fireworks and by staying here we had easy access to everything. I would have been able to give the hotel a better rating except for a few things that, considering the cost of the unit, I found irritating. The dryer didn't work until we had three visits from housekeeping and finally the door needed a hard tug to one side to get it to close and then it worked. The door covering the fridge didn't close properly, the remote control in the bedroom didn't work, and the kitchen lacked some necessary utensils. There was also some kind of water leakage in the car park basement, which caused quite a mess, luckily not on my car but on someones. The rooms didn't have wi-fi but you could purchase time if you wanted. The room was clean and and had a very workable floorplan. There was a fire in one of the apartments in the early hours of 1 Jan, which made the wait on George Street interesting, we didn't get any explanation or compensation for that on check-out. I have been in a Disneyland Hotel and had a similar thing happen and was compensated for our inconvenience, but not at this hotel. It had everything (almost) we needed but I found it lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and lovely apartment”
Reviews.Author: EllisGl
Reviews.Content: The 4 of us, (my wife and 2 kids, aged 13&10) stayed here for 4 nights for New Year's eve and were very pleased with both the location and the quality of the 2 bedroom apartment. Being in the heart of CBD you are walking distance to majrotiy of places, Rocks, Darling Harbour,Circular Key and all the main shopping malls. 2 bed apartment was very well appointed with all mod cons and was very quiet up on the 11th floor. Be warned, the roof pool area is very small with only a total of 4 sun loungers and a tiny pool so if you are looking for down time here, you will be disappointed. Also, at the weekends, as the CBD is deserted, a lot of the bars and restuarants are closed and there is a lack of good restuarants on your doorstep. A trip to the rocks or darling harbour is required. As it was over New Year, we paid a small fortune for this place and perhaps the value for money factor isnt an overwhelming feeling. However, for the location and quality, i would recommend this place and would happliy book here again for my next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising”
Reviews.Author: midwicket
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property and was pleasantly suprised by the space of the studio apartment. It had a separate bedroom area, then a sunken kitchen and lounge. The rooms were quiet considering they are overlooking some very busy streets. The bed was a little too firm for my taste. The kitchen was good, although a proper freezer would be better. The fridge size was good. Kitchen had a dishwasher, oven, cooktop, microwave. The sofa bed is terrible however. Wouldn't put a dog on it. It is also only a single sofa bed. The car park is very expensive at $50 a night, and sometimes hard to find a park. The pool is on the roof with great views. The location is ideal and there are a couple of small supermarkets within 100 metres to stock the kitchen. All in all, quite impressed and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Studios”
Reviews.Author: HappyDaysTravels
Reviews.Content: I just completed a three-week stay at Mantra on Bond Street. The location is great if you want to be in CBD (note that almost everything in the area shuts down around 6pm, though), is a block from Waynard train station, and a short walk to Circular Quay and the Sydney Opera House. Rooms are nice, and relatively spacious for a hotel room (though it started to feel a bit cramped after a couple of weeks), and include a small kitchenette, decent living room area, and adequate bathroom with washer and dryer. On the downside, the bed was not particularly comfortable and the television must have been from the 1980s. There is a fantastic rooftop pool with a BBQ, however, there are only 4 lounge chairs so chances of getting one are slim. Still, the view from up there is very nice and the BBQ is a nice touch. There is also a 'gym' on the top floor that is slightly larger than a closet -- not sufficient for much more than a walk on the treadmill, however, there were enough gyms nearby that this wasn't a deal-breaker for me. All in all, a very nice hotel if you want to be in Sydney's CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: larlaruk
Reviews.Content: stayed here over new year and found the hotel very good, We got a one bed apartment, bedroom with TV and plenty of cupboard space, bathroom good, no bath but powerful shower also a washing machine and tumble dryer, very handy. Kitchen fully equipped even with a dishwasher, Cleaning staff done a wonderful job, made the bed every day and even loaded the dish washer for us, Thing I found so good was the fact that when I used the washing machine the cleaning staff re-placed the packet of wash powder every time i did any washing, also there is washing up liquid and dish washer powder, dish cloth ect, Have seen some people on here have said about noise from street, we were never disturbed by any noise even on new years eve. The hotel is close to all shopping and the harbour. Love it and would stay there again if we ever return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartment”
Reviews.Author: viva12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate new year. The one bedroom apartment was surprisingly large with a very well equipped kitchen and sunken lounge and lovely bathroom with washing machine and tumble dryer. The location is ideal, close to the rocks and Circular Quay to visit the Opera house and to use the various ferries. The hotel has a small cafe area which serves food but there are lots of eateries and supermarkets close by. The reception staff were extremely helpful and the whole area felt very safe. I would certainly return here and cannot recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “"I did not want to share!!!!!"”
Reviews.Author: jenkell
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in July 2011....we loved it! So central to everything....rooms were well set out, clean, & we didn't want for anything. So close to Circular Quay for ferries< Wynyard Station for trains> buses to everywhere & taxis just outside front door. WiFi is not free anywhere now.....that is a problem. We have booked our family in for a few days in February. Would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great studio apartment”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller2012
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the size of the studio apartment. I was expecting the apartment to be substantially smaller but I found the apartment to be well laid out, well equipped and of a very roomy size. The staff were very friendly and I did notice the extra security that the hotel put on at night. The building isn't in a dangerous part of Sydney, but it's always comforting to know that management is going that extra step for its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Access all parts easily....”
Reviews.Author: Jill-Jack
Reviews.Content: Spent Christmas at Mantra, 2 Bond Street, Sydney and was very impressed with it. The staff were all extremely welcoming and helpful and the 2 bedroom apartment we shared had all that we needed, including laundry facilities. A dvd player was promptly despatched to the room so we could watch our Christmas favourite, Home Alone, and, added to the Christmas tree, room decorations which adorned our tables et, our bubble blowing Santa and Christmas lights ( all of which we brought along) we spent a wonderful time. The coffee shop on the ground floor served up a wonderful breakfast and their coffees were second to none. Our only complaint was that the dishwasher was temperamental; however, housekeeping offered to wash all our dishes!! How's that for service!!! The Mantra was sooooo easy to reach via the train from the airport to nearby Winyard station ( 3 minute walk away); the Opera House and Harbour bridge was an easy 5 minute walk, as was the ferry terminal, giving great access to ferry boats to venture further afield. The Rocks area was a delightful 5 minute walk for coffees, meals and lots of small boutique-type shopping. Only real downside was the noise from busy George Street but that's not the Mantra's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: qt_esme78
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mantra on Bond st several times now and have had a pleasant experience everytime. The rooms are spacious, very clean and hotel located close to everything, Staff are friendly and helpful as is the night security guard! Will defiantly be back and will certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- great suite”
Reviews.Author: fandm12
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at this hotel. Located in the heart of Sydney. A 15 minute walk to Sydney Harbour and 15 minute walk to Darling Harbour. The suites are large enough for a family and the staff is very nice. Very much enjoyed the stay. The rooms are comfortable, clean and overall, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance from major attractions”
Reviews.Author: MBond55
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great and the staff were really friendly. Our first room - a 2 bedroom apartment- was facing George street and was quite noisy and the shower door was broken so we weren't able to get into it. When we alerted the staff to this they changed us to 2 separate studios. These were much better as the beds weren't near the window so the noise wasn't a factor and we had more room. I have to admit the two bedroom apartment was quite small and had a poorer layout than the studios.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property ruined by lack of soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: harryjrt
Reviews.Content: We spent two miserable nights here as a result of lack of sleep from traffic noise. We spent one night in level 3 facing George Street and may as well have been sleeping on the footpath.The noise of buses and car horns and sirens went on all night. There is a night club below the hotel and we could hear the conversations of people outside it as if we were with them. A complaint about noise resulting in an offer of an upgrade at our expense to a higher floor - same room configuration.This was only marginally better. Traffic noise was still intrusive. Other inner city hotels such as Swissotel, Radisson Plaza and Amora Jamison do not have noise issues so look at those as options if you want to be in the centre of the city. We paid more than rooms there for this apartment and left feeling like crap after 2 nights of poor sleep. Seriously do not consider this place unless you are deaf or can only sleep with a lot of noise.

Reviews.Title: “So noisy and smells of McDonalds wafting in”
Reviews.Author: Excuseme80
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 br unit for a weekend away with friends an having seen the reviews about noise we asked for a high floor. On checkin we were given floor 4 but after complaining they swapped us around and put us on floor 14. The rooms looked nice and we were quite happy with the customer service provided by staff. We did notice when sitting on the lounge that you could smell McDonalds and on closer inspection saw that the seals on the windows were very poor. In the bedrooms the seals were even worse with a breeze coming through closed windows. Was not able to get to sleep until after 4 am as a night club or something was playing extremely loudly and every hoon in Sydney could be heard driving past. Needless to say we left the following morning and checked into another hotel. While I had expected some noise, this was ridiculous and having 2 pillows over my head did not make it any more bearable. I would not recommend this hotel no matter what floor. Serious work needs to be done on the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - modest price”
Reviews.Author: Hadit
Reviews.Content: Mantra Bond St is really conveneint to Wynyard and Circ quay. Surprisingly quiet, really friendly staff, and all round good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dyan970
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 12 night stay at the Mantra Hotel on Bond/George Street in Sydney. This hotel was so convenient to everything. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was clean and bright. I had a room on the 12th floor - and found it very quiet. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the centre of things. Easy access to all venues etc. I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms dated and dirty”
Reviews.Author: NickTrezise
Reviews.Content: Apartment showing several signs of old age or abuse. Fold out bed was like sleeping on a bed of nails, lumpy springs and stains all over it.

Reviews.Title: “Wot a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Penultim8
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a wotif mystery hotel at a really great price, especially considering the location. Studio apartment was well equipped and comfortable. Handy kitchenette complete with dishwasher and there was washing machine and dryer in the bathroom. I was there over a weekend so noise was to be expected, but was not too intrusive. Staff was friendly and approachable.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Ashy2729
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night over the weekend. I got to reception before checkin time as I requested an early checkin and my room was ready so thought I was off to a great start. The disappointing bit was it took 20 minutes to check in with the assistant manager who was wearing a mantra tshirt(very unprofessional)! I work in the hotel industry so I was expecting to have to do a credit card imprint but as I dont have a credit card myself I asked if they can speak to my partner on the phone to do one with his and was told they would have to send him a fax to fill out and send back... Who has a home fax? i know I certainly dont! So then i asked to do a cash bond, which i know is pretty standard across the board and have stayed in other mantra properties and other sydney properties and have done the same and was met with a flat out NO.. She offered me no other alternatives only leaving me with the option of having a friend come and do it for me.. mind you this was already after 15 minutes of checking in had passed. So basically I was out $199 and had no hope of getting my hotel room and no where to sleep that night! Very stressed out by this time!! So after a friend came and did the imprint for me I was asked if it was just myself staying in the room and I said no it was booked for 2 people. My confirmation from my travel agent said two people but their paperwork didnt. So then I was asked to sign a NO PARTY POLICY. Are they serious? I am a 25 year old mother who was having a night away with my girl friend and I had to sign to say we wouldnt have a party! Fair enough if there was 4 of us but two people? All of this kept adding to the time! So after about half an hour got back to my car and had to move it to their carpark and realised we got no instructions on where to go so just had to read the sign at the carpark gate. Got to our room, which was really nice and very clean!To much furniture in such a small space! Went to look at the compendium to see where the A/C button was and it said to spress the button on the TV and the button would'nt work so had to call down and ask. The room had no deadlock on the our side of the door so I didn't feel very comforted knowing this. The next day went to reception and asked if i needed to get my car out of the carpark first and then checkout or could i checkout then and go get my car. She told me that was fine and checked my account was ok. She said it was al fine and to have a lovely day and took the keys off me. I still wasn't sure so asked if i needed the key in the lift to get to my car and she said "oh yes take this and put it in the box"... Didn'tt bother telling me where the box was and turned and walked away. Overall, worst service I have ever received! I'll never stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good base for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Andrew S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights whilst on honeymoon. Room was a self-contained apartment with small kitchen and laundry facilities, all of a very good standard. The rooftop pool and jacuzzi is definitely worth a visit and the hotel is well situated as a base to visit the main sights of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMontreal
Reviews.Content: The Mantra on Bond is very centrally located for Sydney's Downtown (Central Business District) and steps away from CBD Shopping, the World Famous Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House. Hotel is very nice and we had a studio with full kitchen. I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: barbara p
Reviews.Content: We were tourists visiting Sydney for the first time. We were so pleased that Mantra 2 Bond St had been recommended to us and it lived up to expectations. It is walking distance from so many places of interest, including the opera house and the ferries. The apartment was comfortable, well appointed and serviced regularly. The restaurant serves good meals at reasonable prices, a bonus after a busy day sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “CBD Hidden Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Naviance
Reviews.Content: This property is really well located but you could easily miss it, its almost understated. Close to Circular Quay, George Street and ample local transport is very close. The room was well appointed and comfortable, with a sunken lounge area. The staff were friendly without being too gushy. No great view to speak of from my 3rd floor room but I wasn't expecting one.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: wendy h
Reviews.Content: While this appartment block was without a doubt in the best location, walking distance to any and everything, i too think the advertised two bedroom appartment was a bit miss leading and there were a few maintenance issues that need to be dealt with. if you pay big $ to stay there you don't expect to find chairs in need of some glue, shower seal in need of some re-sealing and the cleaning staff could do with looking up and or underneath sometime. the air vents were filthy as were the underneath of the beds. we always check under the bed before we leave, incase anything has fallen under, and they obviously hadn't been cleaned for years! as for the bedrooms, travelling with teenagers of different sexes, turning up expecting to find a double and two singles, but discovering two doubles, was a bit of a shock. rang reception to find out we would have to pay an extra $40 per night to have the sofa made up. needless to say a bit of kiwi inginueity solved that problem and we used one of the sheets from the double and a spare blanket to make up the sofa ourselves. to be honest with a little care and attention, and maybe double glazing, this really would be the best place to stay! and i'll take the fault as i should've looked and double checked with the travel agent about the room configureation. if you are travelling with friends, or by yourselves, this of course wouldn't be an issue. wendy

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Theresa134
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at the Mantra apartments on Bond Street. The executive studio apartment was spacious and comfortable with full kitchen and laundry facilities. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Walking distance to Darling Habour, Circular Quay and local transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great, spacious hotel apartment”
Reviews.Author: jujujulia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on business in Sydney. Really impressed by the size of the room -- plenty of space to feel comfortable. Bathroom and kitchen both quite modern. Hotel restaurant / cafe was underwhelming, but plenty of great restaurants in walking distance. Overall, really enjoyed my stay and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Raymond and Sue”
Reviews.Author: Ray W
Reviews.Content: Dream location - the night we arrived we went for a walk and in 5 minutes were at the floodlit Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Apartment was warm, clean and comfortable. Quiet, slept well. Elevators were efficient, staff friendly, and there were free newspapers in the foyer every morning. Faults - 1. the kitchen knives need sharpened 2. the food in the (empty) hotel restaurant was terrible - we tasted it once and didn't try it again. Otherwise I would have given this hotel 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: hop_4ever
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mantra Hotel on Bond Street for three nights. It is perfectly located for exploring the city and a nice short walk (5 minutes) to circular quay and the opera house. Shops and restaurants right outside the door, with the main CBD also only a 5 minute walk away. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment and the facilities were excellent - modern, spacious, very clean and quite. I actually had the best nights sleep after a longhaul flight (from Europe) and I am convinced that our comfortable room enabled me overcome my jetlag in one night. Check in staff were a bit robotic, but definitely not rude. After a night out with freinds we arrived back to the hotel at 3am and were greeted by a freindly face on the front desk. I would highly recommend the Mantra hotel to anyone and would definitely stay at there again when visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: VickiW06
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the most perfect location. It only took us 4 minutes to walk to circular quay and 5 minutes to the main CBD. We loved that there was a Woolworths straight across the road and a food hall opposite the enterance of the hotel. Front office staff could have been more tourist info savy.

Reviews.Title: “cbd comfort”
Reviews.Author: smokyharry
Reviews.Content: Great location, very comfortable and classy rooms, very clean, friendly helpful staff and security parking.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ClaireKRead
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the penthouse three bedroom apartment. The staff on arrival were rude when checking in and the remark "enjoy your stay" was made in a somewhat robotic style - not even a smile. Our friends who had arrived earlier shared the same experience so it was not just one's perception. The rooms are dated and stains on the carpets were not appealing. On departing I asked for an itemized account for the minibar but this could not be provided save that they did provide a strange list provided by staff and highlighted for items that we did not obtain. I don't mind paying for items that we have used but with four people in the room, we wanted to share that expense and to know exactly what we were paying for. It was also disappointing when three keys (after three days) would not open doors and the staff blamed this on the keys being near credit cards/phones. I don't believe that this was the case and three of us were locked out at separate times of the day. I rang their reception one night to ask if they could assist in providing an item and was told that they would get back to me "shortly". Two hours later I again rang the front desk to be advised that they could not assist. Simply put, they didn't seem to care in providing any service whatsoever. On a positive note, the apartment itself was generous in size and was central to all city facilities but considering the nightly rate, it should have been. Tv reception and access was very poor. Have stayed at other Mantra hotels on several occasions but would be very reluctant to go back to Bond Street again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the foyer”
Reviews.Author: lns224
Reviews.Content: We only booked here because we could not get in anywhere else on a heavily booked weekend - and were wary given the reviews on trip advisor. However our one bedroom apartment on the 13th floor was clean, attractive and comfortable - if a bit noisy, particularly on Saturday night. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. For us there were two down sides - the foyer and parking. The foyer includes a down market cafe which has quite nice food but very poor ventilation. This means there is a strong smell of cooking fat as you arrive at the Mantra - and this smell goes up into the lifts. The decor of the cafe is very drab and shabby and detracts considerably from the rest of the foyer. It gives a very poor first impression. There is very limited on site parking - which we only found out once we had driven down 10 levels to Basement 5. At $50 a night this parking seems very expensive. Given that only a very few hotel guests are going to get an on site park it would be good if reception offered some other options. Valet parking was mentioned on the website but not offered when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel at 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: nikkiq
Reviews.Content: We were told that the 2 bedroom apartment could accomodate 5 people since there were 2 doubles and a sofa bed. It was a real squeeze for all of us, and with only one bathroom, it too small for 5 people. The place was old and dirty, and still had cigarette ash lying around from the previous guests who stayed there. And forget getting a good nights sleep - the noise from outside kept everyone awake until the early hours of the morning as there is no soundproofing on the windows. This was really not worth the expensive price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure your accommodation suits your needs.”
Reviews.Author: declan17
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bed apartment with a request for a balcony on the assurance of our travel agent that it would be suitable for 5. We were told on arrival there was no such thing as a 2 bed with balcony. False. There is a 2 bed deluxe which has a balcony. Whoever thought a 2 bed with pull out bed would suit a family of 5 - 1 shower/toilet among 4 women - is deranged! We were staying more than a week so ended up upgrading to a penthouse suite at significant extra cost, but it was worth it even if it meant less shopping! Excellent location. Eat out, much cheaper and better. WiFi costs extortionist, buy a hotspot for $79, much better value when shared amongst 5 when all had Wifi access and I had peace & quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely apartment”
Reviews.Author: Chowchowlou
Reviews.Content: The apartment was very well equipped and clean. Lounge area was very comfortable to relax in. The location is good as it is about a 15 minute walk to the harbour and Opera house to the right and shops to the left. Staff were helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “the location is a plus and a minus!”
Reviews.Author: aussiefemale23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in September in a two bedroom apartment with friends, so four adults. The apartment was comfortable, adequate and tidy. We only had two real issues. Firstly we were on the tenth floor but the noise from the street below was exceptionally loud, we could hear people talking and laughing down on the street until the wee hours. It was difficult to get to sleep and considering this is the purpose of staying somewhere like this that was a real downside. The door to the balcony in our friends room wouldn't shut properly which meant they had a cold draft and the road noise was about ten times louder. We asked someone to come and have a look and they simply said it was broken and they had no maintenance person on to fix it. Car parking was $50 per night, which we at first thought was expensive but then we saw the price for 2 hours at a nearby U Park and discovered $50 was a pretty good price. Quick walk to Circular Quay, Wynyard Station and Westfield Sydney. Good location. Only negative was the bad nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Flashy, but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: jarrodburton
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight for a business trip recently in a two bedroom apartment. The foyer is nice and rooms well appointed, but our bathroom looked aged and the shower leaked all over the floor. We were on the second floor and faced George street and I was kept awake for a large portion of the night by traffic noise, double glazing would be a good idea. Mini bar prices were high even for a hotel, and we didn't eat in as the prices were again high. If you book here, ask for a non-street frontage room on the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling Internet means it is unsuitable for business”
Reviews.Author: newkstar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Mantra property several times over the last few years, sometimes for work and sometimes for holidays. Short stays have been in the studios and longer stays in the one bedroom apartments. It has several things going for it. All the rooms have a kitchen and washing/drying facilities, which is very useful. The studio is well equipped and bigger than the normal hotel room. A warning about the bathroom in the studios, though. They are VERY small. The door doesn't completely open because of the placement of the toilet, meaning a bit of contortion is required to get in. If you have any mobility limitation or are on the larger size, I'd give the studio a miss. Also, try to avoid rooms facing on to George St. Sydney is a noisy city at all hours of the night and rooms facing on to Bond St are marginally quieter. The rooms have always been clean and room service food, while limited, is OK. The price varies a lot but if you can get a studio around the $200 mark, it represents quite good value. The location is not bad, roughly equal distance from the shops, Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. The Wynyard train station (with direct trains to the airport) is only 5 mins away. Thus far the review is quite positive and for a holiday stay the Mantra is probably fine but, and it is a big but, I'll never stay here again for business and I would not recommend anyone do so if Internet connection is relevant to your work. Internet access in hotels is one of my big bugs. I think all hotels should offer it free. It is now an essential a part of our lives and should be included in basic offerings. What makes the Mantra really bad is that their Internet connection is $25 for 24 hours BUT there is also a 400mb download limit! Spare me! I went through that in under an hour and ended up using my own wireless broadband for work. Not happy at all. This is quite a rip-off and suffice to say, I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Heather W
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights in an executive studio on the 7th floor of the hotel. The room felt very spacious, and the kitchen was well-equipped with everything that we could have possibly needed. There was also a washing machine and dryer, plus an ironing board and iron. Although the hotel is on a busy road, we heard very little noise from traffic, and could only hear some music from a nearby bar on one of the nights that we stayed, and even that stopped at 11pm, so we were still able to get a good night's sleep. We heard no noise from other rooms (although it's possible that we just had very quiet neighbours!). The location is excellent. About 3 minutes walk from Wynyard station, and about 10-15 minutes walk to Circular Quay. There is also a Woolworths supermarket in the Metcentre by Wynyard, so it was really easy to buy food. The staff that we spoke to were very friendly and helpful, and the rooms were cleaned to a good standard each day. It would have been great to have access to the internet in our room. Apparently wireless internet is available, but since we had not brought our own laptop we had to pay to use one of the 2 computers in the lobby, which costs $5 for 30 minutes. Over all we were very pleased with our experience in staying at the Mantra 2 Bond Street, and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect any frills, extras or even the basics”
Reviews.Author: JKeegan_11
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for three nights at the Mantra on Bond. We were very disappointed with firstly the check in service (the access cards did not work for the rooms and we were made to feel extremely incompetent when we went back to the desk to have it fixed, whereupon they realised it was not our fault) and we were not offered assistance with our bags. We were told as an afterthought that there are trolleys available. Not what you expect from a 4/4.5 star hotel. The parking which we were told was "ample" was charged at $50 a night. There were a total of six spaces allocated for hotel parking on five levels of parking. The rest were private or allocated to "Club 19". After a six hour drive, the last thing you want to do is scour for a park, then have to literally park against one wall, let your partner out, then ferry the bags over the car out one door as it was impossible to open both doors of the car - ie. the driver and the passenger cannot exit the car without pulling forward from the space and letting the passenger and bags out first. This is ridiculous for $50 a night - you would expect an appropriately sized, accessible car space for that money (even if it is in the city). Just over the road at the Amora on Jamieson, it is $48 a night for valet parking, bags delivered to your room! The rooms while clean, tidy and well appointed were very disappointing in the balcony department. We booked specifically because the hotel lists the rooms have balconies. If you want to open one door of the balcony, slip out, then open the other door and close the first one behind you, so you can actually stand on the "juliette" balcony - which is about 1.5 feet by 4 feet in total. There you can enjoy your view of a brick wall. No valet, the TV channels were broken with "no serviceman available until Monday", exorbitant internet charges, all led to a very unsatisfactory experience. We will return to the Amora on Jamieson next time we are in Sydney - definitely not the Mantra.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: Caine1965
Reviews.Content: With a name like Mantra you would expect the best but beware. Good points include central location and room cleanliness. Staff were very polite and helpful. Room was nicely appointed but nothing special. Room was very large. A small family could share easily. I stayed in a room on the first floor overlooking an adjacent alley. I was prepared to live with opening my window and finding a blank, brick wall becasue I got the room cheap, on short notice and was on the final leg of a very long hike. On the other hand the room is directly above an alley way bar and the noise and cigarette stink issuing up to my room was inexusable. Was up to 2am on both nights I stayed waiting for the din to quiet down before I could sleep.. If I had been paying full price for this room I would have demanded my money back. I may add that becase the room overlooks an alleyway there was no natual light in the room at all. There was no jug in the room and no spirits stocked in the mini-bar. Yup. A two - star experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JCB_8
Reviews.Content: I am often having to travel to Sydney for business and this time I was able to get some good rates at the Mantra and booked a 2 bedroom apartment. The check in staff are very good and the room is very comfortable, quiet and well serviced and maintained

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: barcz
Reviews.Content: Had a great 4-night stay here, making the most of the central location. The Rocks, Darling Harbour and the Botanical Gardens all within easy reach and taxis easy to get from right outside whenever I needed one. Security present after hours for some time, which was great to see and later access possible without a problem. The suite was fantastic, with all kitchen equipment necessary and washing facilities so I could get some laundry done before heading home. The staff were really helpful with advice on how to get to certain places and room service was quick & tasty. Didn't manage to get up to the pool because I was so busy, but maybe next time...

Reviews.Title: “In the middle”
Reviews.Author: Rob T
Reviews.Content: We have read many reviews about the Mantra 2, some good some bad so we were a bit confused. Anyway we took the gamble and decided to stay there and requested a suite through a local booking web site at a very good price. On arrival we were pleased with its location, a 5 minute walk to Circular Quay and a 5 minute walk to the city centre. The suite was large, well appointed and best of all a seperate bedroom which is a bonus. We didn't have much of a view but for the price we paid, the hotel location and the room we got, seriously who cares about the view (you should be out there touring). The suite was approximately 60sqaure metres, with a lounge, desk area, kitchen (with dishwasher) two TV's and a good sized bedroom with lots of storage. Overall we loved it, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Handy spot for visiting Sydney”
Reviews.Author: FrancescaNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be more handy for sightseeing in Sydney if you tried. The room was large but very dated. I found a lot of things wrong in the room, ie: no lid for the kettle. Fridge door difficult to open and shut, microvawe door impossible to lift to get into the microwave, toilet seat broken etc etc. I must say though, once I had listed all the things down and handed them to reception, they had them all fixed by the next day, but I couldn't help wondering why no body else had told them, or why the housekeeper/ cleaner didn't get them fixed before it was reanted out again. For the price of the room, I was fairly annoyed wireless wasn't free to the guests. Reception staff were very helpful and we had a late flight, so they allowed us to store our bags in a back room, that was a big help. We could walk to all attractions for down town Sydney. The Rocks is two blocks away, 5 minute walk. main shopping centre is one block away, so you really can't go wrong if you are on foot and want to see everything.10 minute walk to the Opera House and Botanical Gardens. Just over the road is a underground food hall so thats handy as well.Main Railway Station is two blocks away. Would I stay here again? Mmmm, if I could have a room with a view, yes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, nice apartment hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Mlleruby
Reviews.Content: I used to stay here a lot on business about 6 years ago, then I changed company and didn't need to travel to Sydney much. Last week I needed a central spot to stay and went straight for Mantra 2 Bond St. Actually I booked via Wotif as it was on special. I must say that nothing much has changed - it is still an excellent option in the heart of Sydney CBD and a short walk to the Rocks. More spacious than your average hotel and although starting to look a teeny bit tired in the lifts etc, overall still 4 star. Hotel staff were friendly and pleasant, towels were large and thick, bed was comfy and fittings generally luxurious. It was also great to be able to having a washer and drier to wash a few things given I was there for 4 nights and ended up staying in Sydney all week. Constructive criticism: the bathroom was so small it was hard to open the shower door and squeeze out the bathroom door but that's probably because it was the smallest room I've had at 2 Bond St. Had a room service burger and I'd have to say, don't bother with room service - it was really really average. Saturday night was very noisy due to Establishment next door. But who stays in Sydney to shower, stay in and order room service? All in all, a fantastic apartment option and the best apartment location in Sydney CBD (in my opinion)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SRMP
Reviews.Content: We were in an 'Executive Suite' which was far from that. The view of the brick wall didn't help. The outside door for the fridge was broken, as was a shelf in the tiny bathroom. No spa bath. There was lots of fuzzy mould growing in the bathroom. The floor were dirty throughout. The phone cabinet hadn't been dusted in months. Lack of tv channels appalling - all sport an nothing else except children's programmes. The gym was freezing, half the machines were out of order, dirty, no hand wipes and just plain awful. Staff at reception were friendly but that was the only good thing. Cannot really recommend staying there. S&R

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Apartment, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Weemaz23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights on our 2nd stop of our honeymoon. So glad varied our types of accommodation throughout our trip as it was nice to have somewhere to chill out with access to making your own meals & have the extra space a hotel room does not offer!! There was a supermarket close & we cooked in a few nights before heading off down to the harbour which was only a few minutes away. We got the train in from the airport & the hotel was just beside it. Large spacious apartment with open plan sitting room, kitchen & bedroom. The recommended trips were very expensive so we decided on the Hunter Valley Wine Tour. It cost approx 170 aud each & was very expensive however if you are into your wine tasting it is a must & recommended as the best tour. Suppose had we shopped in the city we could have easily spent as much so was glad we went. We took a boat to tarronga zoo & manly island which is highly recommended. Also go to the IMAZ cinema which has the largest cinema screen in the world. We also visited the aquarium which was good. Sydney was quite expensive but if you check out places before you travel i'm sure it doesnt have to be. We had the best meals out of all our trip but i cant remember the name of it, it was the 1st restaurant of a continuous row of about 5 along the harbour with view of the opera house & bridge. fine dining at its best!! Sorry for not remembering thename :-(

Reviews.Title: “No free internet and no free to air digital channels a poor show for a 4.5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: junkbmw
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here in July and were very disappointed with no free internet and no free to air digit channels on the telly. With 3 kids under 6 we were relying on abc 2 for kids to relax after a big day of sightseeing. Also the shower was tired and mouldy smellimg. Rooms however very generous and kitchenette fantastic.Location excellent. A good place to stsy but management needs to move with the times. Recommended but not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wet June long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Vacatrguru
Reviews.Content: Although it rained for the entire time of our stay we found the hotel to be confortable to be in for 3 whole days. Its was well stocked and had plenty of room for 3 people for a studio apartment. the layout of the room gave us plenty of privacy and an extra TV. I would stay there again and hopefully see more of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Suprised at the poor reviews”
Reviews.Author: JayJay0206
Reviews.Content: We had not been to a Mantra hotel before and were slightly concerned about some of the negative reviews we read prior to our visit. However we were really pleased with our one bedroom studio apartment. It was spacious, clean, tidy and very well stocked. There was a seperate lounge area with an additional TV and although we only stayed for two nights we would have been really happy to have stayed longer. The central location is excellent but because it has two busy roads bordering the hotel we did ask for a room on a higher floor to reduce any potential traffic noise. We had no problem with the staff who were all polite and helpful with a quick and efficient check-in. We would definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing business trip.”
Reviews.Author: Shail4u007
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Hotel mantra for 2 months. it was awesome.. i was on business trip. it is very close to Sydney opera house, darling harbor and many pubs... the rooms are tooo good spacious and amazing staff. The swimming pool on top floor is amazing with city view and also facing sydney opera. There also Gym facility.
