If anyone planning for business trip in sydney and that too in CBD then i will prefer them to stay in hotel mantra. It has swimming pool, gym wi-fi , kitchen facilities and many other facilities. Cheers to hotel mantra,

Reviews.Title: “This will be our regular Sydney hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GTPTCO
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this location, the queen bed with a step down to kitchen and lounge dining area, we had south facing room with a small balcony (not used much as it rained all weekend...). This is great location if you want to explore Sydney. It is close to shops, close to 'The Rocks', the ferry terminal, the Opera House and Darling Harbour. We found the room clean and tidy with everything we needed for a short stay. 11am check out was great and the staff at reception were friendly, the night door person was friendly. If you arrive by train get off at Wynyard station exit onto George Street and a short (200m ) walk to the North, to easy, just do it.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms, indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: LiseVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: Although the location was very central, the tired rooms (with a weird lay-out) were tired and uninspired. The pool on the roof could have been great, but it was far too cold to spend any time in! And the staff were indifferent and clearly couldn't have cared less whether we were having a decent stay or not (no eye contact and certainly no enquiries as to whether or not we were enjoying our stay!) We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jjbat35 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in the Rocks which is the suburb with most tourist attractions. Only 10-15 minute stroll to the Opera House and Bridge. We stayed in a studio apartment which had everything we needed and lots of room.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent business hotel...”
Reviews.Author: AllanCLOndonUK
Reviews.Content: Normally stay at the Intercontinental but price stupid with Aussie $ so tried Mantra , Bond/George Street on recommendation. Apart from being a third of the price it is a superb location in the heart of the City with excellent facilities including fitness centre , spa and pool on the roof. Stayed in an excecutive studio with is a bedroom , sitting area , kitchinette and bathroom- all mod cons including washing machine and tumble dryer. Hasnt got the harbour views but is a 5 minute walk to Circular Quay-- will be back..

Reviews.Title: “Central to everything”
Reviews.Author: jaaknich
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights at Mantra 2 Bond Street and really enjoyed our stay. The apartment was of a good size for a CDB Property, the service was very good with a smooth and quick check in and as we were catching a late flight upon check out our bags were stored without any fuss. The bed was extremely comfortable and the water pressure in the shower was terrific. Although the apartment contained a kitchen we did not use any of the facilities as we ate out for breakfast, lunch and dinner. All forms of public transport service this property with Wynyard station only a 5 minute walk away, buses to all parts of the city pass the hotel and the ferries at Circular Quay again are only a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spacious Apartments”
Reviews.Author: AlistairLattimore
Reviews.Content: I travelled down to Sydney in April for a conference that spanned 3 days and arrived at the Mantra 2 Bond Street at around 8AM. The staff were friendly, checked myself and a colleague in (different room) without any fuss and stored our bags for later. I was really impressed with the size of the rooms, for a CBD hotel it was impressive. They come with queen beds, two LCD TVs, full marble bathroom and an open planned living dining area. While I didn't have a need for it, they also have a small but fully functional kitchen as well - which if you were staying a week or more would definitely come in handy. As for using the services, the bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows. The shower had heaps of pressure and was hot, nothing worst than either lacking pressure or hot water that isn't hot enough in my opinion. I also used the iron and ironing board each morning, great iron - hot with lots of steam - the ironing board could have been a little bigger but it was adequate. Checking out was just as painless and we were able to leave our bags checked at reception until the end of the day & pick them up when the conference finished. My colleague and I flew home on a Friday evening at 8PM, so traffic was heavy the catching a cab was going to be difficult but there was a cab rank about 100m up the road on the other side - so that was handy also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Hotel Rooms Very Tired”
Reviews.Author: slnkelly
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom unit. It was very spacious, however the rooms were very tired and need refreshing. In the bathroom there was water damage at the bottom of the vanity. In the lounge area there was mould and water damage in 2 areas. In our bedroom the seals were broken on the windows which made it very noisy. The beds in both rooms were very uncomfortable. We found the way the rooms were run down very disappointing as we had stayed there about 3 years ago and had enjoyed it back then. Given the price we were charged and the poor quality of the rooms we would not go back there. They also charged extra as we paid by credit card - didn't matter which card we used.

Reviews.Title: “Location really good and staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: Johnsonwax
Reviews.Content: Our first time to the lovely city of Sydney and this hotel. The location for us was really good for us as we loved the Rocks area. The hotel is only a short walk to the Opera House and ferries. The staff were very helpful. We would recommend the hotel of anyone thinking of staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: bristolposhpacker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December at the height of the Christmas period so lots of hustle and bustle but once in your room it was very quiet and relaxing. The room was well equipped, spotlessley clean and in an excellent location for seeing all the sights of Sydney. The pool on the roof is really nice and very welcome after a long day of sightseeing. The staff were very polite and low key so you were left alone to enjoy the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: adrianbennett2
Reviews.Content: Two bed apartment was okay. Rooms were well laid out and adequately equipped. Double glazing really poor. None of the windows shut properly. Be warned if travelling with young children. We had an apartment overlooking Bond Street. This is a really busy street with 24 hr traffic and people noise. Location is excellent but standard of hotel is pretty poor.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean and Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Ms_G050
Reviews.Content: After a long trip to Sydney we arrived at Mantra to be greeted by a sour staff member. Once we got to our room i noticed the toilet was running constantly and there was paint peeling off the corners of the ceiling. The room overall wasnt very clean, hair and dirt on the toilet the fridge was dirty with reminates of the previous guests with old straws and chardes of chocolate. The mini bar was missing an item and over priced. Rang down to reception to ask for extra pillows as my partner and i like to sleep with more than two pillows. After ringing down twice a staff member brings one pillow and tries to tell us they have no spare pillows and that they are at 100% occupancy. In a 181 room hotel that is a complete joke. When checking out i outlined the above issues to reception who were not empathetic at all and only offered to give me a comment card to fill out. Mantra 2 Bond street is not worth the money we paid for it. Choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very good accomodation, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisB460211
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a 2 bed apartment on the 7th floor for 3 nights and was very pleased with the quality of the accomodation and most of all its perfect location. The apartment had everything we needed, was clean, quite spacious and overlooked George Street. It has a safety deposit box which is operated by your room card. The hotel is a 10 minute steady walk down to Circular Quay, the Rocks, the Harbour Bridge and Opera House and about 30 minutes walk to Darling Harbour. We purchased our provisions from a supermarket just up the road as the prices in the hotel cafeteria were rather extortionate. We had two lovely evening meals at Jacksons on George which is about 200 yards down the road in the direction of Circular Quay. If we are fortunate enough to return to this lovely city again we wouldn't hesitate in staying at Mantra 2 Bond Street.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a few nights stay but not any longer”
Reviews.Author: w0rktravel48
Reviews.Content: Small studio room was given for a 2 months business stay when a 1 bedroom apartment had been requested. Although this wasn't available at the beginning of the stay there was no attempt to move me in the 2 weeks I stayed there in the end. Having paid $288 dollars for 5 nights before it was reduced (from 3rd January due to being New Year) it was not worth the money. Had to ask for toilet paper twice in 2 weeks, yet on my last day I was handed a full pack of 4! Internet charge is extortionate and not wireless so had to bring a longer cable from work just to be able to use it further away from the internet point. TV channels the most limited i had seen in any accommodation in Australia, even Christmas Island offered more. Room service was expensive and poor quality food. Air conditioning wasn't great either freezing or hardly worked and dripped. Have only a few DVD players available and movie charge was again the highest I had seen during my stay in Australia. Hair dryer poor and they only have a few better ones which never became available during my stay! Would not recommend for more than a couple of nights stay for tourist, not for long term business stay there are far better more comfortable options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cloudlea
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Sydney, we were there for 4 nights and it made an excellent base. Just a short walk from Circular Quay, the Opera House and harbour bridge. Our apartment was lovely, very clean, comfortable and well equipped. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rophybrophy
Reviews.Content: My partner and myself stay at this mantra about 5 or 6 times a year... we love the location, the balcony, the service...everything. It is a little run down up in the spa area/ fitness centre. I do love it here and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WelshNat
Reviews.Content: We landed in Sydney on the Morning of New Years Eve and were very gratful that the hotel allowed us an early check in (After an early flight from Melbourne and a long day/night ahead of us it was nice to be able to relax before we headed out). We were spoilt with our accomodation in Melbourne so felt a bit let down but the apartment here but if we hadnt been in a great apartment before then we would have been more than satisfied with this one! The kitchen was quite small and could only fir one person in at a time which was fustrating and also the kitchen bin was far too small to be a kitchen bin (it was the size of a very small office bin). The air con wasnt very good and it was either too cold or to warm and the temperature could not be adjusted. The windows didnt seem like they were double glazed and it sounded like the windows were open in the night so you can hear all the city traffic. This didnt bother us too much as we were out till late most evenings but if you woke up mid slumber it was often hard to drift back off. You cannot fault the lacation of the Mantra 2, this is within walking distance of the supermarket, Opera House, Darling Harbour...the list goes on. We spent quite a few evenings up on the roof top pool using the Barbeque which was brilliant. You can even see the Harbour Bridge from up there!! The chamber maid was lovely and always made sure we had clean towels and the bed was made even if we were in the room, she really was lovely and I wish we had got her name to inform management of her hard work! Reception staff, not so friendly! On arrival they were pleasent but other times they couldnt even be bothered to lift their head when you walked past them. A simple hello would have been nice when entering the hotel. They have internet to use for $1 for 30 mins which is also handy. Overall enjoyed our stay at Mantra 2 and would stay here again if visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly as good as the cricket”
Reviews.Author: duffercumbria
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel as part of Freedom Australia Ashes package. Room was great - lounge with separate kitchen area and excellent bedroom. Bathroom with great shower and supply of continually restocked toiletries. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful, printing off maps and timetables for us and they booked a trip for us (a great visit to Hunter Valley wineries) Washing machine/dryer was excellent provision with supply of washing powder The location is very handy as other reviewers have said and we walked most places - Opera House, Circular Quay, Rocks, Darling Harbour - and even SCG where we were lucky enough to watch the final Ashes victory

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and apartment very spacious”
Reviews.Author: Caroline2401
Reviews.Content: Stepping out of Wynyard station and having a short walk to this hotel convinced us that we had picked the ideal location to explore the city. The staff were helpful allowing us access to our room prior to the advertised check in time. Our two bedroom apartment was clean and spacious with a large sitting area. It was lovely to relax on the balcony before heading out for dinner each evening. The kitchen was well equipt and if our stay had been longer the laundry facilities would have been appreciated. We had noticed that a few visitors to this hotel had commented on the noise in relation to the city centre location but we certainly encountered no problems in this area. Circular Quay, the Rocks, Darling Harbour and the Victoria Building were all just a ten to fifteen minute walk away. Our children are the first to complain if they are required to 'hike' any distance and there were certainly no complaints over the weekend. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would certainly return for possibly a longer stay in order to take full advantage of the excellent facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: SteveSmith222
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. The staff are easily the best thing about the place. There's a few things that could have been explained better (like the air-con control inside the cupboard) which I think would have been explained if there was an in-room intro book like most places have. Instead, the Mantra has an on-TV system to guide you through things. Unfortunately, ours wasn't working which meant we had to ring Reception a few times just to get basic information. But the staff answered courteously and explained everything patiently. What would have been frustrating was instantly not so because the staff were brilliant. The breakfast downstairs was a little bland but again, it's hard to notice when the staff serving it are so friendly and accommodating. They certainly understand what being in the hospitality industry is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: Cjmj77
Reviews.Content: Good location for central Sydney, and fairly priced. All amenities, good little kitchen and washing facilities. Expensive extras, and very expensive internet. No wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service!”
Reviews.Author: New_Zealand_dream
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and chose it for it's location. Overall the experience was nice, however on first arriving to check in we were greeted by a poorly mannered counter clerk. We filled out the check in details asking for a complimentary news paper, however this never turned up. The rooms were ok. Spacious and good cooking facilities. The fan in the bathroom was unable to be turned off, so that was a little annoying. The spa was dirty on one occasion and we thought the pool area was in need of a good clean and some paint. On checking out we were served by the assistant manager and I must say she was great. Very professional and friendly. This was an exception as every other visit to the front desk was awful. Overall it was ok. Do shop around as within this price range I'm sure there are better hotels, especially when it comes to service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Desilvajenni
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for Two nights during our honeymoon. The room was nice and the location was walking distance for all of the attractions in Sydney. There is even a washer/dryer in the unit as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value based on location”
Reviews.Author: harperharper
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks in Oz and although the Mantra 2 Bond is not the cleanest hotel you'll ever stay in, it is one of the best located and provided more than adequate room for this family of five. I'd suggest they get all of their windows cleaned and do a much better job dusting - but nothing that couldn't be tolerated. It was a good value - provided us with two bedrooms, a nice living area with a pull out sofa and a decent little kitchen, too. The bath is relatively small, so plan on taking turns. It was overall a fine place to stay - the location is great. It's an easy walk to the Opera House and Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably price hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KJS2003
Reviews.Content: We used the Mantra for 4 nights just after new year when we were in Sydney for the cricket. Overall it was a pretty decent hotel, not brilliant but far from the worst I've stayed in. Its strong points were that it offered good value for money in an expensive city and that it's central location was excellent. We booked a 2 bedroom apartment and the one we got was in good condition. It wasn't by any means perfect and could have done with some redecoration, but it was more than adequate for our needs. It had a small kitchen with a washing machine & tumble drier. The hotel is situated on the corner of Bond Street & George Street, the latter providing a huge selection of shops, bars & restaurants (we didn't eat at the hotel for no othe reason that we were out and about most of the time). The Mantra is only a 10 minute walk from many of Sydney's harbours, the Bridge and the famous Opera house. It was also near most of the transport hubs, so getting around was easy. Our room allowed some noise from the street below but it wasn't a major problem to be honest. The trip advisor ratings system doesn't allow you to mark a hotel as 'good' which I would have done in this case. The Mantra is not great, but is by no means bad, and if you are after a reasonably price hotel in Sydney in the heart of the city, you could do a lot worse than the Mantra.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location what a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: dahlia8
Reviews.Content: Booking hotels is always a frightening process. One never knows what to expect. The Mantra 2 Bond Street was a welcome sight after a 14-1/2 hours flight from Los Angeles. We had 4 rooms booked. Even though I had the most people in a room I had the smallest 2 bedroom however it was a very ample 2 bedroom (on the 11th floor). After reading previous reviews regarding bar noise I requested a higher floor for all rooms. No one complained about any noise. Our other 2 bedrooms were located on the 14th floor (larger room than ours and a larger bathroom and sitting area) and the 10th floor (similar to our room). The one bedroom suite was huge! All rooms were spacious and comfortable. The kitchenettes were a welcome sight for us each morning. We purchased food from a grocery store inside the Wynward station which was about a block away. We found Australia to be quite expensive and it was nice to be able to save money by preparing our own breakfasts. Our living room had a pull out sofa. The other 2 bedrooms had large and very comfortable beds. The bathroom however was very small. Between having the stacking washer and dryer it was a very cramped space. We did love having a washer and dryer and picked the Mantra for this reason. Internet was expensive. $27 for 24 hours of internet. Overpriced! We went across the street and bought an external internet modum for $40. Why a hotel finds it necessary to charge that much for internet is beyond me. The front desk staff was so-so. Some were very friendly and some were surly. Our housekeeper wasn't very friendly either. There is a food court across the street and down some stairs. We had lunch at that food court several times during our stay. Great variety and the food was actually tasty! Location was wonderful. Close to most of the attractions including Circular Quay, the Sydney Opera House, the Botanical Gardens, the Rocks area as well as the Sydney Bridge. We walked everywhere. We took the 555 to Chinatown once but for the most part we were so close to all the other attractions it was easier to walk and the weather was gorgeous and cool making walks pleasant. The restaurant in the hotel was overpriced. The food was definitely not something to write home about. Great location and a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: thedublinrambler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for almost 2 weeks and we found this hotel to be in a great location, close to all amenties of Sydney. We booked a studio apartment through www.apartmentplus.com.au as they seemed to have the most competitive price. However this meant that you do not get linen change or towel change but you can wash them in the washing machine and dryer but this is not what you expect to do on your holiday. The apartment had a small but fully functional kitchen along with a washing machine and dryer in the bathroom. The apartment was very clean as was the corridors and lobby in the hotel. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel as it is very close to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, The Rocks and the shopping centres of downtown Sydney. On our last day we availed of the Airport Shuttle bus at $12 per person. You need to allow up to an hour journey time to airport but it is very worthwhile if you are travelling solo or as a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Dublinlocal
Reviews.Content: The following review is aimed at more assisting first time visitors to Sydney, especially those visiting from UK/Ireland/Europe, staying at this location. Although it is detailed, I said I'd include a few additional tips that might help other families. Travelled as a family of 4, 2 adults, 11 year old boy + 7 year old girl. Booked via Trailfinders, which was about 10% cheaper then booking direct. Was EUR2,200 for 9 nights for a 2 bed room suite (not the junior, the slightly bigger one). I thought price was a little expensive. Location - great. We had originally looked at booking similar apartment hotels down at Darling Harbour and Liverpool street. These were approx. 20% cheaper, but if you afford it, this location is perfect for a 1st time visitor, especially those using Sydney Ferries. The Rocks is within walking distance, as is Opera House and Circular Quay. The free CBD bus (no. 555, every 10 mins) is about 100 metres outside the hotel front door. Great for getting up to Hyde Park/Townhall. Used it 6 times during our stay. Be warned, it can get caught in the very heavy traffic on George St, especially during building works at weekends. Assume it may not come for 20 mins, or may be full on arrival. Requested a high floor, and one facing onto Bond St, due to previous comments about noise at weekends. Got one of those 2 beds on the 11th floor, with a corner balcony facing onto George St. Noise was not as bad as expected, but I think the windows are only single glaze. Hotel was busy, and seemed to turn away a lot of guests without bookings especially at the weekend Booked a hire car via the hotel, which worked out well. Mid size was AUD108 approx, per day, which was a lot more expensive then booking directly. However, AVIS delivered the car (upgraded to a Toyota Prius) for me to collect from the hotel underground car park by 8am. I parked the car that evening back in the hotel car park at 11pm, and AVIS picked it up the following morning. Considering the hotel charges AUD50 per night for parking, as do most locations the nearby, the quoted rate seemed good considering I had no messing about with collecting the car/dropping it off the following day. Also despite driving approx. 275 kms, it only cost AUD16 to refill. The tolls seem a bit of a nightmare, but I will know in 2 months if I got it right! Internet is only available in the lobby, but they also have PC's there, and it costs $6 per hour. You can also print there, which deducts time off your balance. Note: There is an internet cafe across the road at Wynard train station (called Galaxy), where internet costs $2 for 30 mins, reducing down the more you use. I think hotels in Australia need to look at this, as this would generally by free all over Europe and the US,in my experience. Free newspapers are a nice plus! Food: The cafe downstairs seemed to charge a lot (example: $11 for a breakfast cereal+ fruit). However, it seemed busy. We used the Chinese restaurant across the road. A lot more expensive then those in UK/Ireland, and menu different. Also ordered, and then collected some pizzas from Pizza Hut at St Martin Place which is a 5 min walk. Would also recommend Woolworths in Metro centre, over Coles. Had more deals, but was still very expensive wnen compared to UK/Ireland. Rooms: AC in rooms. We only found the controls at the end of our holiday - located inside the main bedroom wardrobe. Washing machine/dryer very good. Note: They have plastic/paper recycling tubs on each floor, in the refuse collection room. Swimming pool = as per previous posters. Small, full with 2-3 families. But high views over Sydney sky scrapers. Kitchen was good, as was dishwasher. Small. Balconies were good, but the corner ones are very small. Staff - very good reception staff. Especially the night porter. No concierge. On the final day (Sunday afternoon), hailed a taxi outside to the airport. Used the tunnel, which meant we got there in about 30 mins. cost was AUD44, plus tip. Overall, a nice apartment hotel complex.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartment shame about the night club next door”
Reviews.Author: Pommy4
Reviews.Content: This apartment was brilliant in terms of location, facilities, cleanliness and staff. The only thing that let it down was the noise from the night club next door. With the windows shut, ear plugs and a pillow over my head it was not possible to block the pumping music and screaming drunks. If the club is shut i would highly recommend it, or if you could ensure you get a room away from the main road - but otherwise give it a miss if you want somewhere you can sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: chipnchair
Reviews.Content: DH had a business trip and I tagged along. We stayed at the Mantra 2 Bond for a full week. Overall, the property offers excellent value as the location is top notch and the rooms are a good size and have great amenities like a full size kitchen and washer and dryer. Cleanliness: We had a studio for the week and it was cleaned daily. I couldn't figure out the schedule as some days the room would be cleaned in the morning and other times in the afternoon. You can probably call and try to arrange for your room to be cleaned sooner rather than later as house keeping seemed accommodating. Location: The location can't be beat. It's in CBD right by the Wynyard train station, but also an easy walk to Circular Quay, the Rocks and the Sydney Harbour Bridge/Opera House. We walked down to Chinatown and Darling Harbour almost every night and besides large crowds (it is the business district after all), it was easy and very safe. The weekends are quieter and less crowded. Rooms: We had some minor issues with the bathroom. I stubbed my toe in the dark forgetting there is a tiny step up. There is a drain in the main bathroom ( wet room style) which we realized was helpful because the shower can flood. In our room, the washing machine also leaked, so the drain was useful. Don't get me wrong, this was easy to overlook because I was in love with the Washer/Dryer in the room. We were able to do several loads of laundry during our stay and house keeping replaces the detergent if you need it. We loved the full kitchen set up also. They have mini bar items, but still lots of room for you to put your groceries or beverages as well. You can bring leftovers back to reheat. Service: Was excellent. The front desk was professional and quick to assist us with any needs. We used them for simple tasks like mailing post cards (stamps available at post across the street) or making change. Value: As mentioned, overall value is excellent. If you can -- avoid hiring a car or using the parking in the hotel. It was $50 a night and spaces are limited. Sleep Quality: is excellent. We were on a lower floor, though we didn't experience issues with George Street noise. We're city folk and ambient noises are normal to us. We slept well as the bed is located toward the back away from the street. The bedding is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: k8travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for a 4 night mini break. It's a 5 min walk to circular quays, the rocks, opera house and 10 min walk to darling harbour. It was nice and clean, basic, but better than a hotel as each apt has small kitchen, fridge, microwave, washer, dryer etc. If we go back to Syd, we'll stay here again for sure. Only thing I'd suggest is that when booking a room maybe ask for a room at the back of the hotel as the rooms at the front are really noisy from the street noise. But you'll get that anywhere in the CBD. One restaurant I'd suggest which was a short walk from the hotel was The Pony Lounge.. so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: tinatspoon
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated to make all of the city sights accessible on foot. Very clean and roomy though nightlife a bit noisy for those on a lower floor at weekends, but guess this can't be helped when being situated in the thick of it! Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good but noisy and no bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Martynk
Reviews.Content: Nice place, but our room had a view of a brick wall, so very dark. Also because it's the CBD it can be very noisy at night, and more important many rooms do not have baths, so you can't have a good soak. Other than that ok, but not for us

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: HOMEORWAY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mantra for six days, five nights, great location within walking distance of the Rocks area, the Bridge & Opera House, ideally located for shopping, bars & restaurants. Would advise using the hotel Concierge services to book trips very efficent and direct to all major companies involved with day trips, would highly recommend a day out to the Hunter Valley.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: Emscooby
Reviews.Content: we had a suite which was great and had just about all you need, and was very roomy. The location is great for Circular Quays and just a short walk to Darling Harbour, and very close to the Rocks. Its a CBD hotel so there is some traffic noise along George Street but overall a very clean and nice location. We asked for a high floor and got one with a balcony and a great view into the city, so its worth asking for a balcony if you want one. There is a small but clean rooftop pool too. turn left out of the hotel and you are heading right into shopping district. Great hotel and our second stay there. Parking is available underneath the hotel for a daily rate.

Reviews.Title: “Convient”
Reviews.Author: Tullagirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convient to eveything in Sydney including The Rocks, Circular Quay, Opera House etc. The railway station is just a short walk across the road and there is also a Woolworth's supermarket across the road in the Arcade on the way to Wynyard Railway Station and just a couple of blocks down George Street is a Coles Supermarket . The staff are all very friendly with a Good Morning or Afternoon when you walk past the reception desk. Rooms are lovely with a full kitchen and the best applances and plates etc. Also a washing machine and dryer so you have everything that you need at your finger tips. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to spend just a weekend or longer in Sydney as you donot need a car as the buses stop outside the door or it is just a short walk to Circular Quay to get onto the ferries or just across the road is the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Boosh085
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one lovely week. Can't think of a single bad thing to say. Room was very nice and well equipped, including kitchen and laundry. Great location, caught the train from wynyard station, very easy walk and close to the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel, much better than some rooms I have paid double the price for.

Reviews.Title: “Great appt hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: Torngats
Reviews.Content: Just checking out after 4 nights here, only shortcoming would be the bathroom as mentioned in other post, but the pluses outway any negatives, rooms are large and very modern, would recomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hope it's not booked on my next trip!”
Reviews.Author: themitchellfamilyaz
Reviews.Content: I travel around the world for business, and usually stay at the Hilton. On a last minute recommendation, stayed at M2, and was very, very pleased. Was worried about housekeeping, which can be prob. with apt/hotels, but they were great. Only neg is no real rest (quasi-lobby), but overall, a great find! (city apt kitchen, and market 8 min walk away up George - stock up and don't need room svce.)Was very pleased - great experience. Fantastic location, nice pool, helpful staff... Can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and reas priced at 200 aud per night but”
Reviews.Author: shound1030
Reviews.Content: at this price you expect decent quality toilet tissue.NOT unseratted low quality rolls.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: NZ_Paul
Reviews.Content: Love Sydney, its a great short break. We chanced upon the Mantra by choosing a mystery 'wot deal' on Wotif. This is an apartment complex which also doubles as a hotel. The rooms are a lot bigger than you would expect, with a nice little kitchen and even a washing machine in each. The only small issue was the bathroom which tends to flood pretty badly when the shower is running. The location is great for inner city exploring, which we did on foot with no issues. The pool is a little misleading in the images, its actually really tiny and a bit random, but fine to cool off.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location with perfect apartment for 2 people”
Reviews.Author: SK1973
Reviews.Content: I booked Mantra after finding it on Google Maps and reading the reveiws on TripAdvisor. I must say I wasn't disappointed at all. Location is fantastic - right on the corner of Bond and George Street (Circular Quays end). Those that know George Street, this place was a couple of doors away from the bar The Establishment. Its about a 10 minute walk to Circular Quays and the ferries, and then maybe a 20-25 minute walk to Darling Harbour. George Street was perfect for shopping with the Queen Victoria Centre about 10-15 minute walk from the hotel and Pitt Street about 10 mins away too. We pretty much walked everywhere. Getting the bus to Bondi was easy as we just walked down to Circular Quays. The apartment was perfect for a couple with a comfy bed and a sunken lounge and kitchen area. Bathroom was small but adequate. Some reviews did complain about the street noise but to be hoenst we didn't expereince any and we were only on the 3rd floor. We couldn't hear the people nor the traffic. There was a pool which we didn't check out. We paid only AUS$150 per night which I thought was a bargain considering the location. I have stayed at the Shangri-La as well which although is a much nicer hotel, I felt you got more at the Mantra - given the location and the fact that we had a small kitchen area. Well worth staying here if you get a cheap deal!!

Reviews.Title: “practically perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: paganviking
Reviews.Content: i've just returned from an extended business trip to australia. i stayed at mantra 2 bond street on two separate occasions and have nothing but good things to say about the facility and its staff. excellent location, comfortable, clean, well-appointed quarters (with en suite kitchenette and laundry), exceptional guest service, secure off-street parking (albeit a bit expensive), and excellent food make mantra 2 bond street a sure bet. my ONLY complaint is that the weekend revelry from george street persists into the wee hours of the morning and tends to disturb sleep if one's room is on the lower floors. (thank goodness for princess valium) the mantra group has locations throughout australia... if the others are half as good as 2 bond street, i see little reason to search elsewhere for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb Place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: geeraa
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. The location was great, the accommodation was top class, the staff were simply wonderful from the reception to the room staff, and although it is situated in downtown George Street the rooms were surprisingly quiet. Ours was a studio - and it was complete - from washing machine to clothes dryer - everything a bloke's wife needs!!! Whenever we are in Sydney again Mantra 2 Bond Street will be an automatic choice! Well done Mantra.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Sydney visit”
Reviews.Author: Giantroad_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal for our traveling around Sydney with bus on George Street the Ferries and Train only a few blocks away. The room was very comfortable although a little street noise at 3 am and our room being on the 2nd floor and close to the lift well voices could be heard outside our door. Staff are very helpful. I would not recommend the Airport Shuttle service they use which took a full hour door to door leaving us apprehensive about missing our plane.

Reviews.Title: “Ok venue in busy part of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Bob1949
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Mantra 2 for three nights but checked out after the first night. The location is fine, a few minutes walk to Wynyard and right in the centre of town. It is bustling but noisy outside the hotel and inside. Receptionists were helpful and the bonus for us was being able to get a check in at 9am after a flight fom Singapore from where we returned due to the volcano fiasco but we should have been heading to London. The one bedroom apartment was spacious and well fitted out and had washing powder etc. My one complaint was that it was noisy in the bedroom due to an air conditioning system outside and you really couldn't escape the fact that you were right in the centre of the city. For one night it was fine but I wouldn't want to stay longer and it was certainly over the top price wise at 300 dollars a night. I can see how for a business traveller who needed to be in the heart of tings it would be a good option but it wasn't for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, clean venue”
Reviews.Author: greyhound804
Reviews.Content: Great location - 5 min walk to Circular Quay and 10 min walk to Darling Harbour. Easy to get to from airport - train to Wynyard Station and a 5 min walk from there. Staff were friendly and helpful. We stayed for 4 nights in a studio apartment with a small balcony looking over George Street. Definitely recommend it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: The-Grant-Family
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a 'Junior 2 bedroom', and given on the 15th floor (always prefer high floors). The rooms were of reasonable size with very comfortable queen beds in each room; reasonably modern bathroom with spa bath and shower over; laundry facilities in a cupboard off the hall and a huge terrace, albeit shared with the next interconnected room. Difficult to work out which room was the main one - both had access to the roof terrace, but one had the TV and the other had the CD player. The kitchenette was very minimal, firstly being located in a wardrobe of the bedroom that we decided was the second room for the kids. In addition to the fridge that was otherwise the mini-bar, there was a microwave, kettle and some plates, glasses etc. There was no sink or hotplate - you had to wash the cooking equipment either in the bathroom or the laundry trough. Did not have many dealings with staff, but they appeared happy to help when asked. (The only issue was we left a note for room service that the CD player was not working...came back at the end of the day to find a note from maintenance advising us to contact reception! Why could maintenance not refer the matter to reception earlier in the day? We were leaving the next day so did not bother). We were too busy to visit or use the swimming pool etc and did not try the bistro so cannot comment on either. At least on the 15th floor, room noise was not an issue, although the alarm clock in the next room did bleep for an hour in the middle of the evening - could have reported to reception, but not too noisy. On the whole, a reasonable standard of hotel in a good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Saintsational76
Reviews.Content: Our dislike of this hotel started at check-in. We were told that due to the fact that we didn't own a credit card that we would have to pay a cash deposit to cover incidentals. Fair enough - happy to pay it. Not happy when despite receiving the cash deposit they still removed all traces of the mini bar from the room. Not a good start. Two bedroom apartment was smaller than I expected. Not worth the high price that we paid for it. Customer service was lacklustre to say the least. Made an enquiry about the airport shuttle service and was told that we would have to come back when the shuttle service staff were available. Hotel staff did not provide any information or offer to help in any way. Ended up catching a taxi to the airport. There was constant noise from traffic, car horns, music and party goers all Saturday night. Not to mention some construction that is going on across the road. If you are considering staying at this hotel I would suggest that you spend your money elsewhere. You will probably get better value for money, service and a quieter stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small side”
Reviews.Author: QueenofFit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled with our two young children and his father, and booked a two bedroom apartment. I found that the apartment a bit on the small side, and the shower really tiny. Other than that, I was happy with the kitchenette, and being able to wash our clothes during our five day stay there. However, if would probably choose an apartment hotel closer to the shopping areas and the restaurants, as the kids get tired with the walk up to the main shopping area, and the free CBD buses stop running at 3.30pm on weekdays (except Thursdays), and 6pm on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Noisy, poor service, spotty cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: mr_roadwarrior
Reviews.Content: This place is next door to an extremely noisy bar by the name of Establishment. If you have to go to work in the morning - forget this place...you'll be up all night listening to the "boom...boom....boom" of the lous music throught the walls, the horns blaring and people who queue up in the alleyway which borders many of the rooms. The staff act as if helping you or answering your questions is a kind of burden. Unprofessional is the norm. I had a refrigerator that stunk like a mouse died in it.... Take your company's or your hard-earned money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book with "ApartmentPlus.com"”
Reviews.Author: JourneyBC
Reviews.Content: We spent a considerable amount of time searching the internet for an apartment to rent in Sydney for one week. We found one we liked on ApartmentPlus.com. When we arrived we were given a different apartment in the same building (Saville Apts. on 2 Bond St.). We were very disappointed in the apartment we were given. There was less furniture and it was older (only a loveseat in the living room to sit on). The pots & pans were very old and linens were very basic - no face cloths, one hand towel and only 1 kitchen towel. There was a big stain on the mattress cover. I was glad to leave the apartment. The only good thing was the location of the apartment. The apartments are individually owned and rented by ApartmentPlus. The hotel probably has better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “lovely and spacious with full kitchen”
Reviews.Author: michellejeanette
Reviews.Content: spent our annirversary was a great location and enjoyed the setting of the apartment, the roof stop pool was great except it needs an area for rain, all our clothes got wet whilst swimming.... staff need not come around and check bar at 4pm..privacy was ignored.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for Sydney sights”
Reviews.Author: pools82
Reviews.Content: The Mantra 2 Appartments were an ideal base for us to use whilst in Sydney to see our daughter. It is a very short walk to Circular Quay and the Rocks, and not a lot further to Darling harbour. We walked a lot during our stay! Our appartment was immaculate and well equipped, we felt we were well looked after, including having your own laundry facilities. The staff were always helpful and polite, with directions, answers to questions and loaning umbrellas if needed. The rooftop pool was quiet, and although small it was never busy, it was a good place to go and cool down on the hotter days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent except no bath”
Reviews.Author: LeighCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Excellent location close to GPO, circular quay and the rocks. We had a one bedroom apartment which was clean, room sizes good, kitchen well equipped. We were with our one year old and required a cot and high chair. Both were delivered within minutes of our request (cot is additional $10 per night). The only negative comment I have to make is that the bathroom only had a shower- no bath. The shower was good however. Our room was serviced daily and complimentary newspaper delivered to our apartment daily. Definately recommend

Reviews.Title: “Downhill....”
Reviews.Author: jamesking
Reviews.Content: I used to rent an apartment in this building when it first opened, and therefore when looking for a place to stay with my sister, brother-in-law and nephew (aged 3) I remembered my time at 2 Bond street with fond memories. 10 years had passed since I last saw an apartment in the building, the foyer still looks very good and is presented nicely. The staff were fine at check-in and did their job well. On arrrival into our 2 bed apartment (1413) I noticed that the front door was all scuffed, and a serious paint job was needed. Opened the door to find that the room had not been touched (paint, decoration etc) since it opened. The carpet was stained, there were chunks of wall missing, and the 2nd bedroom was missing the wardrobe doors. Because of an ACDC concert and the start of the Mardi-Gras, the hotel room was very expensive. $520 a night for a 2 bedroom self contained apartment was way beyond what should have been paid for this apartment. I felt let down, and was embarrased, because I had recommended the apartment to my family. I made a complaint to the management, who gave me a $100 credit per night for the room. I assume that they were well aware of this type of complaint, because it was offered without any issue. The apartments are in a fantastic location, about a 7 minute walk to circular quay, handy for shopping on George street, and almost next to Wynyard Station. Until they perform maintance on these apartments, I would suggest that you find an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment with good facilities”
Reviews.Author: VHMW
Reviews.Content: Stayed in exec studio with fully fitted kitchen, clean, well furnished and spacious. Only criticism was dirty windows, but would definitely stay there again! Great location and most of staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The main room lacked comfy seating.”
Reviews.Author: swanniejenn
Reviews.Content: My husband & I took my cousin visiting from the UK to Sydney and stayed at this hotel, in a 2 bedroomed appt. Rooms were great, the main one very roomy, but had only one chair in total. No desk or table. I sat on the floor to eat & drink. Lovely balcony with doors from both rooms, but again no seats to sit & enjoy the atmosphere. The appt. had great potential, as it was very quiet and roomy, but had no comfort. Would I go back - not until it was made more comfortable. We are all early 60's and look forward to a sit down at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel well located but noisy if you have a room overlooking George Street.”
Reviews.Author: Passportholder
Reviews.Content: This is an apartment hotel with kitchen, lounge/diner & washing/tumble drier facilities. The room was a good size with two double bedrooms. Kitchen well appointed including microwave, cooker, toaster etc. Reception staff were very courteous & very helpful. There is a relatively small restaurant area on the ground floor that provides breakfast, lunch & dinner but we did not use it. Our room was cleaned daily to a high standard.. The hotel is ideally located for Circular Quay were you can get numerous ferries to differnt locations around the harbour. It is also close to the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge & the Botanical Gardens. If you are self catering there is a good sized supermarket a few minutes walk away in the Wynyard station complex. Numerous bars & restaurants nearby. There are many office blocks close to the hotel so it does quieten down over the weekend. The only drawback to this hotel is that it can be noisy if you have a room overlooking George Street. In the early hours you can often hear people shouting as they walk by hear the traffic & you can certainly hear the sirens from emergency vehicles.

Reviews.Title: “Furnished Apartment”
Reviews.Author: stownshend
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the private apartments in the Mantra on Bond. Excellent location and nice hotel. I had some issues with the apartment itself - managed by Apartments Plus. When I arrived the dish washer, waste disposal, and air conditioner were all broken, but they did send someone to fix it. I would rate the hotel a big yes, but Apartments Plus a big no. The location is the best thing - really close to Wynyard Station, Opera House and Harbour Bridge, and there's a pool and spa on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot”
Reviews.Author: JaneC65
Reviews.Content: Good, clean rooms. Great location - an easy walk from Wynyard Station or Circular Quay. Well equipped rooms - we had a studio with a queen and single sofa bed on split levels. I was surprised to find a real kitchen with an oven, cooktop, dishwasher, m/wave which made it handy with kids. Good aircon once I found the control panel->in the wardrobe of course! Helpful staff but plan evening meals ahead if you have kids as that end of town is pubs and offices an a restaurant - other than the hotel's - was a challenge

Reviews.Title: “Soooo noisy and loud impossible to sleep in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lolokenya
Reviews.Content: do not stay thete a bunch of drunk teens stay there over the weekends and they go wild and slam the doors 10000 times.trust me you dont want to be in that situation , its torture.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ...overall great stay.”
Reviews.Author: leethomo
Reviews.Content: We had a great one night stay in a 2 bedroom appt. This was the perfect choice for us. There were two bedrooms with the queen main room having a small juliet balcony, opening windows and a flat screen tv and great large wardrobe. The second room was similar size with workdesk and wardrobe also...and opening windows too. The lounge area had a foldout sofa bed, several lounge chairs and a dining area with dining setting... along with a large flat screen tv and stereo cd unit. There is a full kitchen with oven and microwave and large fridge, washing machine and dryer complete the great package....overall this room choice was a perfect size for larger familes or two couples. There was a problem with our airconditioning, this was sorted out EXTREMELY FAST and to our complete satisfaction. Management were exceptionally good and having travelled extensively in Australia and internationally, I have never had a problem attended to so well as what Mantra Bond St management did with this. The hotel location is excellent for nightlife and very close to Circular Quay. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation and great location”
Reviews.Author: diva_sparkles
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a weekend in late November and were very impressed with the hotel itself and fantastic location. We stayed in a Studio which looked out right down on George St, was reasonable size (have to love 2 televisions when the boring soccer is on!), clean and very comfortable. The kitchen was fully self-contained and quite large. The bathroom was a little on the small size - it was a bit of a acrobatics act getting in and out the door to the toilet - but was beautifully tiled and water pressure was good. We used the pool during our stay and found while it is a bitter smaller than what the image of the website would lead you to believe, it was clean and enjoyable. The weekend we stayed was particularly popular with hens nights but we still managed a quiet and enjoyable stay. The hotel is located close to Wynard Station and is a short walk to Circular Quay and the Pitt Street Mall. Only gripe is and we were warned for this by other reviews is the quite pricey parking - if you can get away with using public transport the better as its in a great location, otherwise be prepared to fork out $50 a night! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Handy to The Rocks and Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: packaporte
Reviews.Content: The first room we were allocated smelt of cigarette smoke, we opened the door to the little balcony and there was a glass full of cigarette butts. Rang reception who were very professional, they said ALL our rooms are non-smoking, please come back to reception and we will re-allocate you. They put us one floor higher and this room had a very strange smell, but it wasn't smoke and we stayed. Room was split level which separated the bed from the kitchen and living area well. TV was not huge. We found a Coles supermarket a few blocks south and enjoyed our 3 night stay in this convenient hotel. The site we booked through mentioned free DVD/video hire, but this meant you could use a hotel DVD/video machine. In-house movies had to be paid for and the pay TV was mostly sport which was disappointing. One staff member lit up a cigarette just outside the main door which is not a good look for a supposedly non-smoking hotel, and we also saw someone smoking on another balcony. We used the airport transfer and for $12 per person it was good service with a clean mini-bus and a lovely driver.

Reviews.Title: “Great room even better location”
Reviews.Author: lau050505
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the mantra 2 for 5 nights over the christmas period. We stayed in a studio appartment which had a great little kitchen and a balcony over looking george st. It was a five min walk to the rocks and circluar key and only a ten min walk to all the big shops like David jones and myer. We found it so easy to cacth the bus everywhere and took the train to wyndam station from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - upgraded to a 3 bedroom apt for free!”
Reviews.Author: doondoon
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2-bedroom junior suite for one night for a wedding and ended up being upgraded to a beautiful 3-bedroom apartment for free. There was everytthing you could want, including a spa. I needed 2 cots for my young twins which was provided with no problem. My only gripe would be the cost of parking - $50 per day which is more expensive than even the Hilton which is $38 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: EBCChristchurch
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 nights at the Mantra 2 where we stayed in a studio room. It was incredibly small room 408 and I get the feeling it was the worst room in the complex. Having seen the other studio rooms down the hallway they all seemed alot bigger. I requested a portable cot which was not in the room when arrived late in the evening. they however did bring one to our room somewhat later there was no linen for it and when I requested some all they could come up with was a single sheet folded in half. Luckily I had 2 blankets in the pram for my son. We also had a sofa bed for my other son which was bizare as it was a very small single that folded out of a 2 seater sofa. We had to rearrange the room to fit in the cot. Having moved the dinning table to accomodate it there were furballs other accumulated goodies under it. these were never vacummed up during our 6 days there. Breakfast was over priced and my teenage son had the panckaes which was one small pancake for 16 dollars? We dinned down at cockle bay for breakfast after that and it was fantastic. Having paid 300 NZ dollars a night for the room it was very dissapointing. Have stayed at Medina Harbour side and will go back there next time. Heaps bigger rooms and alot better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girlfriend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Angelina_jNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mantra 2 Bond for a weekend getaway with my girlfriends and saw Wicked (Which i HIGHLY reccommend). Check in was fast and the service was VERY VERY excellent. We had a few problems in regards to rooms but they were fixed up so quick. I got a very reasonable rate from www.wotif.com and booked a one bedroom apartment in a special deal for $139.00 for 3 people. The room was reasonable and very clean, and ONE TIP: the air-con switch/controls are in the wardrobe. We couldnt find them for an hour and were very stuffy in the rooms. The rooftop pool is quite small but has lovely views and is great on a hot day to relax. Central to everything, undercover car park (at a $50 fee per car) and a very comfy bed. Was a great weekend and would stay again - mainly because of staff. I think her name was rebecca. she was fabulous! =D

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, with brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Kwise
Reviews.Content: Coming directly from the airport i found it very easy to find the hotel as it was almost opposite the Wynyard train station. I arrived early but the lady on reception said she would mind our luggage and call us on our mobile if the room was ready ahead of schedule which it was. The rooms are spacious with a living area, self contained kitchen and two tv's. Very comfortable rooms. 5 min walk and you are in circular Quay and the Rocks. We actually had a wedding at the botanical gardens which was also a 15 min walk so it was very handy - (take flat shoes) Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: AussieJools
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights and had the best experience. The staff were friendly and helpful and took no time at all to attend to any needs I had during my stay. The service was prompt and friendly. The maid service was very good, it felt nice getting into a nicely made bed every night. They even unpacked the dishwasher for me!! The location is great, close to Pitt Street, Sydney Tower (even tho all the shops in are closed right now), a quick train to the Quay, Kings Cross etc... really good spot to be in if you don't have a car. I can honestly say that this stay was on of my best in the past few years. Cheers Mantra!

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples”
Reviews.Author: dr_rob80
Reviews.Content: Booked here on the recommendation of a friend. Largely, we were not disappointed. The studio apartment was spotless and well appointed, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was a bit pokey and water tended to leak on to the floor from the shower due to only a small lip to prevent it from happening. Staff were fine. We didn't sample the breakfast, so I cant comment on that. Location was good, close to Wynyard station, but the north part of the Sydney CBD is very quiet on weekends (during the day) and there's not much open in terms of food. This wasn't a huge problem as we spent the days sightseeing and eating elsewhere. At night, it turns out there are a few nightclubs in the area, including next to the hotel. Other people had complained of the noise, but we weren't bothered by it- though the noise of the other guests was a bit much early in the morning. It seems this place is popular with outer-suburban Sydneysiders as a base for a night of clubbing. The halls and lifts reeked on Sunday morning of hair-gel, cigarettes and cheap deodorant. I'd probably stay here again. It would certainly suit those in town for a longer stay as it has washing facilities for clothes within the suites, and quite a well appointed kitchenette. Watch the mini-bar, prices were outrageous!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -shame about the noisy guests”
Reviews.Author: rojaan1
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom apartment. Queen bed, separate lounge/ dining area, kitchenette - well appointed. Nice furnishings. Had dinner in the restaurant one night - very nice meal. But the negatives outweigh the positives- We stayed here for two nights (Fri & Sat) Both night we were woken at 3am and 4am by people returning to their rooms. Loud, noisy and obnoxious, one swearing excessively. It spoilt our stay for sure. The bathroom shower door does not seal properly so the bathmat was saturated both days. The water got to where the washing machine was so moving the bathmat made no difference ! Parking is $50 a night !

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: VivienneSydney
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get this hotel on a mystery deal - fabulous location, quick check in, lovely big room & balcony great view of Australia Square - unfortunately we didn't get time to sample the breakfast. We really didn't want to leave, two nights was not enough. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Family of Five- close to most attractions”
Reviews.Author: BRLAAdventurer
Reviews.Content: Mantra on Bond Street is an excellent hotel for a family of five needing queen size beds. We had an apartment style hotel room which had a kitchen, two bedrooms, and living room area with a pull out sofa bed from a couch. My three teenage aged children and wife were very comfortable. This hotel is very close to the Wynyard train station making it superb for getting to and from the airport. Most attractions are within walking distance of the hotel. The only small negative was the street noise from George Street although this was minimal and eventually subsided as the night wore on. The hotel staff was very professional and friendly. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: AussieChook
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mantra 2 Bond St Sydney for one night in July 2009. The building is located on the corner of Bond and George Sts so is a very central location for everywhere in Sydney CBD. It is a very high rise building but the lifts were excellent and fast. The apartment (I stayed in a one bedroom apartment) was a good size, with entry hall (bathroom off this hall with laundry cupboard in bathroom), small kitchen, living room with dining table and a queen size bed room. The bathroom - only had a shower but good water supply and lovely shower products and a good hairdryer. The washing machine, dryer, ironing board, iron were all in a compact cupboard inside the bathroom I didn't check to see if washing machine powder was included (sorry!). The kitchen had a microwave, fridge, sink, dishwasher, pots/pans/cutlery/crockery etc for at least two people, stove top, oven, kettle, toaster. There was a full mini bar. The downside was there was only one tiny portion of long life milk in the fridge, enough for two cups of tea, but there is a 7 Eleven store about 50 metres from the hotel so milk could be got from there. The furnishings were lovely, in very good condition and felt quite opulent. Bedroom had a tv as well as another in the living area. A safe was inside the cupboard. Breakfasts were OK - continental style if you had it included in your room rate but a fuller menu for a la carte choice. The breakfast cafe had a very limited menu but there is also a good in-room dining service that was well priced. There aren't many restaurants located close to the hotel but taxis are always close by. The room was quiet (no view) and all in all I'd recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in central Sydney. It was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: sadtab
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom apartment and facing George St but was amazed that there's hardly any noise at all despite the constant sound of fire engines..........Location was not too bad but its quite a distance to walk (if raining) to ChinaTown. Overall we were impressed with the apartment .......... Will stay again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Danish H
Reviews.Content: At first when we arrived to the hotel, we thought we have made a wrong choice for staying here. The train is too far, not much of shops and restaurants and people are unfriendly. Well, we were wrong. If I have walked the right road, the train station is just right across the road, many restaurants along the way, and not to mention the shops are stretched along the way. We manage to find a nice chinese restaurant and got hooked up with the food. We found our love spot, a Lindt cafe, right in Sydney, and boy, the chocolate waffle and croissant are absolute divine. And just a short walk, you will reach QVB shopping mall. Shop till you drop if you have the cash. We found a shop called Lush, a company that sells organic soaps, bubble bath, and other sorts bath items. The first we discovered this shop was in Venice. Imagine how happy we were when we saw that shop. Bought loads and loads of soaps. Just like other mantra hotels, you will find a fully equipped kitchen and laundry. Very convenient and cost friendly for you. But don't bring too much of clothes, because you will tend to shop till you are kinda overload. You can actually ask the hotel to let you use the weighing machine to make sure you are not overload. Totally nice hotel and try to explore it yourself. Of course, don't forget to get onto a Hop On/Hop Off bus to have a general view of Sydney. Purchase the ticket online and saves you 10%.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely accomodation, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: summerbabyBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment with our 16 month old daughter who they supplied a cot for at an extra charge but a highchair for free which was great! The staff were all really helpful nothing was too much trouble. The apartment was lovely perfect size, really well equipped kitchen and nice clean bathroom. The location was about a 5 minute walk from Circular Quay, 2 minutes from Wynard Station for the trains. Perfect spot for exploring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: stlouiegirl81
Reviews.Content: Location. The main reason to stay at the Mantra 2 Bond St. is location. It is roughly 3 blocks to the Circular Quay (where you see the Harbor Bridge & Opera House) and 3 blocks to Darling Harbor (Great tourist spot, lotso of restaurants). I was traveling with my parents who are both in their 50s/60s and not in excellent shape for walking, but this was great walking distance to tourist attractions, restaurants, bus pick-ups for them. Also, our room was on a high enough floor that we didn't hear the traffic below. Room and amenities. Another great things about the Mantra is that most of the hotels I looked at in Sydney only slept 1 or 2 people to a room, but the Mantra came with 2 bedrooms, plus a sofa sleeper, kitchette, dishwasher, kitchen table, washer and dryer, 1 bathroom. My cousins stays in a room with 2 king beds, no kitchenette, and a private outdoor hottub on their balcony. I imagine this would be a good place to stay if you had little kids. The sofa sleeper was not comfortable for the 25 year old male in our group, so he put the cushion on the floor to sleep on it. There was a restaurant downstairs for breakfast but it felt more business-y. We picked up cereal and breakfast food at the nearby Cole's Grocery store and ate breakfast in. While we liked the room and it was generally clean, the phone was extrenely gross and dirty. It's not the Ritz, but we were comfortable here. There was an in-room blow dryer, but we got an extra one too. Service. I believe people might live in this building too. The front desk is quite small, no concierge service, didn't really seem to be the place to get advice on where to go / what to do. My dad got yelled at by the front desk when he called a second time to request towels. We thought maybe we were supposed to be washing our own towels in the washer/dryer, but found out that we had just gotten a crabby front desk worker. I wouldn't say we got poor service, but it just didn't seem to be a focal point here. What I liked Best about the Mantra: Location! Space! Kitchenette! Washer/Dryer! What I liked Least about the Mantra: Service and could have been a bit cleaner I would definitely stay here again and recommend this to a friend, especially for the location if you want to do sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “great Location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ukmercman
Reviews.Content: I visited Sydney for a week and used this hotel.I arrived at 07.00 in the morning after 25 hours travelling from the UK and went to check in , just expecting to drop my bags off.The great service started from there when I was told the room was ready now , so I wouldnt have to wait until 3pm.Granted this is out of season and a room was obviously empty , but a lot of hotels will not let you into rooms even if the hotel is empty , before the usual check in. Hotel is 5 mins walk from circular quay , botanic gardens , and 15 mins from darling harbour. Excellent room , city view , you can see the harbour bridge from roof top pool area. Only negative points , no free wifi , or not available at all in room and sky high internet charges in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTraveller40
Reviews.Content: Great service and lovely rooms. Location was just perfect as we were in Sydney for a Wedding just two dorrs down from the Establishment Hotel. I would recommend the Mantra 2 Bond St. to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment Hotel in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer53
Reviews.Content: The Mantra chain has locations throughout Australia, but the only one I've stayed in is at 2 Bond Street. The location is perfect for travellers arriving from the airport, as the train stops just one block away. My family didn't want to rent a car, so the location in the CBD was ideal for walking to the Rocks, Circular Quay, Fish Markets, Opera House, Harbor Bridge - all of the major sites within easy walking distance. The staff was exceptionally accommodating and gracious throughout our week-long stay. The rooftop pool and gym, onsite restaurant and view from the balcony were just a bonus. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Guest1801
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the mantra bond street during april 2009. The room was gorgeous, but might I add that the service is terrible. After my stay, how I was treated was incredibly rude including the hotels manager not returning my phone calls, and the receptionist dealing with me in what seemed the rudest way she knew how. This has also happened to a friend of mine. There are definatley much better hotels in Sydneys CBD.

Reviews.Title: “perfect position”
Reviews.Author: cazhad
Reviews.Content: We had an aprtment room which was brill but sorry we didn't have a balcony otherwise it was perfect for us. we spent 5 nights sight seeing and ithe hotel was in the best position for all the usaul sydney attraction.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place I would stay next time I'm in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: byanka82
Reviews.Content: After our average stay at Courtyard Marriott Parramatta (which was not my choice, by the way), I was soooo impressed with our stay at Mantra 2 Bond Street. I booked direct through the mantra, because it was no cheaper anywhere else, and I wanted to cut out the unnecessary 'middleman'. The One bedroom aptmt was booked out, so we opted for the one bedroom dlx. Our friends booked the executive studio. I can't stress how enjoyable our stay was!!! The staff kindly provided 2 portacots for us, free of charge (as we had 2 kids under 2 with us) Our room was spacious, clean, quiet and modern. In the morning, it was so nice and quiet and dark (with the curtains closed), that our kids slept in until after 8am! BONUS! I also saw our friends exec studio room, and that was just as nice. The kitchen had everything we needed. I strongly advise looking on google maps for grocery stores nearby the hotel, to save time finding a place to buy food items for your stay. Our balcony was narrow, and faced the building across from us, but I really didn't care. When I booked, I knew the apartment position probably wouldn't have views anyway. The balcony was basically so you could go outside. There's no room for chairs or anything. The mantra also had a gym and a lovely roof top pool. My main concern when booking, was LOCATION. I did DAYS of research, and this was the ONLY place I could find that had the perfect location for the right price (we were on a bit of a budget) When I say location, I mean that the apartment was located smack-bang in the middle of Darling harbour, the city,mall, and the ferry terminal. It was equal walking distance to each of these places. Perfect! If any of you love shopping, I was in awe of the David Jones shopping centre. I couldn't find it at first, and had to ask for directions, but if you go there, on one side of the road is about 8 levels of womens department store, and then on the other side of the road is about 8 levels of mens department store. I was in heaven! I also walked to the ferry with the kids, and took an easy trip over to Tooronga zoo. Was so easy to get there. And didn't take that long either. There is also a secure car park too, but I can't remember if there was a nominal fee for it or not. Anyway, I think you get my point...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: snifter
Reviews.Content: Really good location, views aren't amazing but on level 16 we had views overlooking the streets which was fine. The apartments are really nice inside, our 2 bedroom was quite roomy. Clean and tidy apartment, nice interior. The only down side would be that the kitchenette we had was in the small bedroom, right next to the bed which made it a little uncomfortable to access. But overall it was a fantastic stay considering the price we paid to stay there. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “No fuss convenience”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaAndDavid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mantra overnight for business at the end of November. There is not much that can be said about this hotel other than it is in a very convenient location, it is comfortable and the service is professional. The rooms are actually much bigger than a standard hotel room and include full kitchens. While my stay was very brief and hectic, it was made much easier by the highly professional staff - nothing was too much trouble. I've never quite had an outloook like this hotel though - the window was literally a foot from a brick wall which meant it was quite dark.

Reviews.Title: “Mantra 2 Bond (private apartment)”
Reviews.Author: SDPadres
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a private apartment in the Mantra 2 Bond located in the CBD of Sydney for a week in Aug. 08. (Through Apt.Plus) We had a one bedroom place, not a studio for a family of 3. It had a complete kitchen, and washer dryer in the unit. The rooms were spacious and quiet. We did not have access to the daily maid service, though we did ask the front desk questions and they were gracious and helpful. The roof top pool was a tad chilly for an adult but my daughter had fun in it even though its small. There is a jacuzzi and a small work out room. The location is ideal. Less than 50 meters from the nearest underground train station and 5 minutes walk to the Circular Quay and the Rocks area. Within the metro station there was a grocery store and more eating areas than we could count. After spending a week being a tourist I was glad of the location, it was a pleasure to get up in the morning and be able to do a quick jog through the botanical gardens, or over the bridge without any effort. Talking with others who were staying at the hotel they were quite happy with the facility. Price was $1050AU for the week for us. (plus cleaning) Very nice over all stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: Annylou
Reviews.Content: My husband I recently stayed for the weekend. We booked on a special deal ($193 inc breakfast) from a television travel show. We arrived at approx. 11am which was too early for check-in, so the hotel held our bags with no problem for us till later that day. They also held them from 10am check-out till 4pm on last day. This was really appreciated by us. The split-level room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. Bathroom was marble tiled with an excellent shower. We had 2 lcd tv's - one in the living area and one in bedroom area. Everything was in very good order and we cannot think of a single thing which was not to our liking. As others have indicated, its position on George St was very convenient. We were on the 7th floor and didn't find it noisy, it helped that we were exhausted from walking everywhere though! The staff were friendly and the buffet breakfast on Sunday was excellent . Probably would not eat there if that was not included though - too expensive! Just a little thing on afterthought - the cleaner put on our dishwasher with 2 mugs and 1 glass! Extremely wasteful given our water shortage. Also would be good if the 2 bedroom apartments had 2 singles in the 2nd bedroom so we could take the family. Would stay again for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: tyggerss
