Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a year ago in April for a little over a week. It was ideally located: close to the train, ferry quay, restaurants, and shopping. So many sights were within walking distance (like The Opera House on the spectacular Harbor and The Rocks), or we just hopped on the train or ferry. (The voucher for unlimited travel on the ferry/train was well worth it!) The studio suite was large and clean. Having the kitchen and a washer and dryer was wonderful! The bathroom was exceptionally clean; the shower doors sheeted water and did not need to be wiped down! We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but there was an inexpensive food court right across Bond and a supermarket just up George. I noticed that the hotel is now owned by Mantra and the prices have gone up, though. We would recommend it highly, however. A beautiful city and very friendly people!

Reviews.Title: “Loud and not so family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Marcelco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 2 Bond Street on a Friday and Saturday night with our baby and toddler. It was extremely noisy at night (due to traffic on George St, nearby bars, pubs and clubs). Would recommend you request a room at the back of the hotel, away from George St. Also, our 2 bedroom suite did not have a bath or laundry tub, so we had nowhere to bath our 6 month old or 2.5 year old sons. There wasn't any toddler friendly food on the room service menu and was advised that they couldn't prepare anything that wasn't on the menu (not even some toast or a simple sandwich). Our room hadn't been serviced properly on arrival. The dishwasher was still full and there was something nasty in the bottom of the bin in the kitchen. There was no dish cloth/sponge in the kitchen and when I requested one, I was given a tea towel. I had to insist on a dish cloth and eventually one arrived. They also messed up our breakfast order (we only received half of it). However they did fix this up promptly and were apologetic. When we arrived they suggested that we unload our hire car in their car park, which we did and then we returned the hire car. They tried to charge us $35 in parking for the short time that we were in the car park. Best to unload your car in Bond St if you want to avoid parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Average place to stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: Sat1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks for a business trip. Was booked into an executive suite which was quite comfortable. First was given a room on the 7th floor which was immaculate and very quiet. (excluding the little outside noise that you can hear and live with). Was told the internet connection was included in the room rate unfortunately it wasn't working so they moved me to the 13th floor. This room absolutely stank and was very dusty. Made me wish i didn't complain about the internet connection. Once i logged in I realised they were charging extortionate rate for internet access. Forget it! Even the IT support staff think it should be included. Think the lower floors are kept for business travelers and the upper floor for holiday makers. The upper floors are definitely more used and a little more run down. You get loud groups staying up there who want to party hard at the weekends. The room service menu is very basic and fairly limited, but the location is superb. Only a couple of blocks to circular key (opera house and bridge) and The Rocks. Darling habour takes about 10-15 mins walk. Got the Oz flu whilst I was out there and was really bad one night. No doctors were open so the hotel arranged for a hotel doctor to visit who charged AUD$300 for coming out. Ouch!!!! Did the Blue Mountains tour with FJ tours. Too much time is spent at other places and only an hour at the blue mountains which has 3 rides to do. You don't really get time to appreciate where you are coz youâ€™re so rushed. I wouldn't recommend these organised tours. If possible take the train out and do it at your own pace. Think there is trolley service that links the mountains and the rail station. Also went out to Manly and climbed the pylon rather than doing the bridge climb. The sydney tower also has fab views but the bridge and opera house are obscured by the high rise buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: mfnMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I booked an Executive Suite for my recent trip to Sydney as I was quite happy with the room and service when I first visited last year. Unfortunately, my recent stay contradicted my experience in the hotel the year before. First of all, I was made to wait for my room until 2:20pm (check-in is at 2pm) because there was a problem with key cutter, and when I finally got into my room I was a little put off by the muggy stench of the room. I went straight to the balcony to get some air in but when I tried to open both (slimline) doors they were both stuck and wouldn't open at all. And to top it, my view was in fact a brick wall and a half demolished building. Despite my growing annoyance, I then turned on the LCD TV to check out the news, thinking they would have CNN and Bloomberg (as indicated by their site) and all I had access to was Sky and Fox Sport. I specifically returned to this hotel for access to an opening window/door and these business TV channels, so of course I was not happy. I contacted the front desk and a concierge was sent up to check the door and he too had great difficulty trying to open the balcony doors. He managed one and said I had to open it with some technique. I'm still not sure why maintenance was not contacted by the concierge. To cut a long story short, I eventually cut my Saville stay to one night instead of 3, for the sheer fact that I couldn't stay in a hotel where the service and accomodations are certainly below the 4.5 star standard it claims to be (LCD TV or not). On my departure, reception didn't even bother asking why I was unhappy and moving to another hotel. This, I thought was quite disturbing. At the room rate available at the Saville, you may as well stay at Four Points Sheraton which is only slightly more expensive but well worth it, when you're treated like an actual guest. M. Navera

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: robertexeter
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks , could not stay any where better in sydney . suite was excellent , huge bed ,very clean , staff fantasic nothing was to much trouble for them, would love to stay there again. we also stayed at the Saville suites in brisbane, same standard there also

Reviews.Title: “Easy base to explore Sydney”
Reviews.Author: pjp195708
Reviews.Content: This is a superb location for exploring Sydney and they provide free car parking. It is only a five minute walk to the Rocks and Circular Quay, five minutes to the main shopping areas and 10 minutes from Darling Harbour. We had a studio apartment which contained a king bed, a kitchen with all mod cons, seating area with TV, ensuite shower which also had a cupboard with a washing machine and tumble dryer in it! Bonus if you like to travel light. The reception staff are really helpful, there are plenty of lifts, the gym and pool are a bit small and the restaurant serves a good standard of food. I was a bit surprised at the latter because there are so many great places to eat nearby that I didn't expect them to try very hard.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartment...but the noise!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2poms
Reviews.Content: We had requested a high floor via our agent after reading Tripadvisor reviews. When we arrived we were given a 2 bedroom apartment, upgraded from a one bedroom, on the 8th floor. There are about 17 floors. This met all our requirements and we really did appreciate the washing machine/tumble drier. The rooms were spotless with the exception of the upper reaches of the shower cubicle where there were patches of black mould. Wednesday/Thursday nights were fine. There was some traffic noise, only to be expected in a big city. However Friday and Saturday nights were AWFUL! Even on the 8th floor there was constant very loud noise from the nearby pub and from people screaming, shouting, revving up motor bikes and hooting car horns until 3.am This was enhanced by the emergency services using their sirens as late as 3 am. Lack of sleep meant that we did not enjoy Sydney as much as we should have done. In all other aspects we felt that the hotel and its staff were above average.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room on a high floor!”
Reviews.Author: solace71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Saville 2 Bond St the weekend before Christmas. Couldn't of hoped for a better hotel to suit the weekend of xmas shopping, work and catching up with friends. Only major downside is the fee for Broadband (really this needs to be incorporated into room rates). There is a steep charge for parking as well ($35 per day) but that's Sydney for you and you have to wear it if you're going to drive.. The rooms are comfortable and have everything you need. Full well decked out kitchen (including mini bar) and laundry. A fantastic touch was full size washing/ detergent packs. No need to find a convenience store to upgrade from the usual sample packs you get in serviced hotel apartments that only last one wash. Reception were accommodating to my request to be moved to a higher floor after I saw the view from the room they initially gave me. I did not want to spend the weekend looking out onto a brick wall! That was in an executive room on lvl 8 (and I suspect) all the ones below. I was moved to level 12 with no fuss and the view of George st and neighbouring office blocks was just fine. No post card but more personality then a brick wall! I was more then happy with the executive studio - it was open planned with the bed pretty much in it's own space between the kitchen and the bathroom (which is a little small) - with a full size built in wardrobe. The bed was extremely comfortable! Past the kitchen was the lounge / dining area with sofa bed, arm chair and dining table for 4. There is also a small balcony. Non smoking rooms that really did seem like no one had ever smoked in them before which was great. Overall $169 (no parking, broadband included) for the studio is a great rate for what you get. In fact it's pretty hard to beat in Sydney. The hotel feels new and is exceptionally clean and well designed. The pool on the roof level is great if the weather is good - small view of the harbour. I had a major hassle when checking out - getting charge twice for my room! On arrival back home 10 days later I noticed the $500 'security deposit' they had taken had also not been returned to my card. A number of phone calls later the situation was sorted out - but having all that money taken out over the xmas period didn't make me too happy. Hotels should only take an imprint of credit cards and not freeze funds. No matter what they say they are never returned with in 'a few days time'.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting, absolutely putrid”
Reviews.Author: aroma83
Reviews.Content: let me just start by saying that the saville hotel in sydney was the most disgusting hotel i have ever stayed in! the rooms smelt like damp carpet and the level of service was utterly ridiculous. the staff seemed more on the ball than management. clueless some were! meant to be a 4 star hotel, i wouldn't even grant this hotel half a star. i'd rather stay in a backpackers hostel and pay double, (not to mention the fact that the saville hotel is severely over priced) if you are planning a trip to this hotel i sincerly urge you to rethink your decision, trust me you will regret it, just like i and the others i stayed with do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation, service, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Viscount812
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked on our behalf by Trailfinders. Withe my 17 year old son accompanying my wife and self, a two bedroomed apartment was the ideal way to avoid the dreaded single room supplements. And this hotel was an ideal choice. Spacious comfortable rooms, complete with flat screen TVs in the lounge and master bedroom, and a complete kitchenette with a washing machine and tumble dryer included in the room and in the charges. Clean warm and comfortable. The hotel has its' own small restaurant, but being located right in the centre of the business district, there were many places to eat out locally at bargain prices. Just down the road was Jacksons at George - and their superb cooked breakfasts at about $10 each and unlimited coffee and orange juice for another $2.50. Watch out for local eateries offering $10 steaks in the evening - we were never disappointed by one of these! The hotel is perfectly located - a couple of minutes walk from Wynards station, 5 minutes to Circular Quay, 10 minutes to the Queen Victoria Building Mall (QVB). In short, you didn't waste time or money getting anywhere in central Sydney - you were there. The icing on the cake with this hotel was the level of service that was provided in a friendly manner all of the time. Particularly when we first arrived at 6.45 in the morning bleary eyed having flown in direct from London with just a couple of hours break in Singapore. We asked if we could leave our bags with reception until our room was available for check-in. Bless them - they moved things around and found an excellent room that we could go straight into and stay. That enabled us to crash out for a few hours and recover from our journey. They'll never know how much that gesture was appreciated, but it truly was and they didn't charge us a penny for it. That was the kind of hospitality we experienced for the rest of our stay as well. I cannot recommend too highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Get the right floor.”
Reviews.Author: SimonSouthampton
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 09:30 AM on New Years Eve somewhat tired after a poor flight from Singapore. I had read the previous reviews about noise levels and as it was New Years Eve had requested a high level room. When we checked in we were given a room on the first floor, and even after some discussion was told this was the only one available. We went to the room which was located on the corner of George Street and an Alley way down the side. It was gloomy and smelled of smoke, and was noisey at 10:00 in the morning. We went back to reception and was tol that the manager had found a 2 bed appartment on the 9th floor if we were not hppy with the previous one. A much better room and location, however the rooms are showing signs of age and could do with a major makeover. The rooms were however clean, and cleaned on a daily basis. Interesting views over George Street, New Years eve was noisey with the windows open, however the Double Glazing worked very well. Location is brilliant for the whole of Sydney, we were able to pop back during the day to drop shopping, pick up water etc. The cooking and washing facilities are OK, more for doing a pizza than anything more elaborate, however they do have all the things you would need to cook a 3 course meal. Overall a good place to spend 5 days in the City, would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “the good the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: bob-a-roo
Reviews.Content: The good news is this hotel in the heart of the CBD is probably the quietest we have stayed in. (we were on the 14th floor) The bad news is the bedroom in the Suite was so small it was impossible to take a suitcase in there or even get changed, so whoever is in the living area is treated to a strip/dress show each day. The ugly is the bathroom is on the opposite side of the suite to the bedroom and up two steps so be very careful when you use the bathroom in the night as you stagger out of the mini bedroom through the living room up two steps and into a shower which has no lights, quite novel we thought, a shower in darkness. Have to say the staff on reception were very helpful and pleasant. We did ask the manager for help with a larger bedroom but she was far from interested.

Reviews.Title: “What a find! - Great location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sarahspassport
Reviews.Content: I really struggled over where to stay in Sydney - I wanted style, location, facilities but I was also watching my budget. What I found at Saville 2 bond could not have delighted me more. The location was perfect for access to the Rocks, the Opera House, parks and the CBD. My room was beautifully appointed with 2 panel TVs, granite kitchen and bath, comfortable bed, crisp linens and my treasured washer/dryer. The front desk staff was lovely and though weather did not permit, the rooftop pool looked inviting. For a true fitness buff the workout room would come up short but unless you're willing to pay the price, you can't have it all.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to previous standard”
Reviews.Author: RINSO84
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights. The reason we chose Saville 2 was that we wanted a apartment and we used them very successfully before. Saville 2 Bond was an excellent location for The Rocks, Circular Quay, Opera House and shopping, however Saville 2 bond did not meet our very good experiences at their properties in Adelaide, Melbourne and Perth (twice).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: wandererCheshire
Reviews.Content: Good location for seeing the sights, but the staff were totally disinterested. The 2 bedroom apartment had one tiny toilet/shower room and the built-in appliances were well past their best. The 4 night stay was a disappointing contrast to the Saville apartment in Brisbane, where we had stayed the week before and the staff had been very helpful and the apartment was spacious and well equiped.

Reviews.Title: “Saville - Perfect Retreat in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: PM-Rich
Reviews.Content: For a quick stay or longer getaway, the Saville in Sydney offers a great location to base your activities from. Priced right, our efficiency apartment was perfectly located in the "Rocks" area, right across the street from the Wyndam train stop and a five minute walk from Circular Quay. While small, the apartment was fully furnished (right down to dish detergent, paper towers, coffee maker, etc.) and offered all the needed conveniences. Bed was comfortable (important to me, with a bad back) and the shower was sublime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DublinPaul
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Saville for a week in April and thoroughly enjoyed. We were upgraded on arrival to a suite which suited as we had a 9 year old with us and gave us a little extra space. The suite was very comfortable and clean with everything we needed. The small pool on the 19th floor was great for our child to play in, especially to cool down after a few hours wandering around the city. The only negative was the noise from the airconditioning. The bedroom looked out onto an internal shaft where all the air conditioning units were situated. Even with the windows shut the noise was very annoying. Apart from that everything was excellent and its location, 5 minutes from Circular Quay was a major plus. We were also able to park our car in the underground car park which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The filthiest hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Lesley M
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the strength of the reviews in trip advisor. Yes the location is good and the appartments are well-appointed but tiny. We had a two bedroomed one but the bedrooms were only about 3' wider than the beds all round. The living room/kitchenette was dark and dingy. But the entire appartment was absolutely filthy. The windows outside were so dirty that you could hardly see out and inside they were almost as bad. We stayed here for four days and the room wasn't hoovered or dusted once. The beds were made and the dishes washed but that was all. There was ingrained dirt around the shower and washbasins which I could scrape off with my nail. The shower door didn't fit properly so the bathroom floor flooded every time it was used. Apparently they are in the process of refurbing the hotel but I would steer clear of it until this is done.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Keentraveller50
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Saville 2 Bond Street and we were even more impressed this time around. We had a one bedroomed apartment on the first occasion but decided to stay in a studio as it was a bit cheaper. They were both very well-appointed and serviced daily. It is only about five minutes walk to Circular Quay from the property and despite being right on George Street, one of Sydney's main thoroughfares, we weren't bothered by noise at night as the aircon works well. The property has the service and quality of a hotel with the privacy of apartments. We would stay there again without hesitation.

HotelInfo.Name: Mantra 2 Bond Street
HotelInfo.Address: Cnr of George & Bond St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia (Formerly Saville 2 Bond Street)
